Cooperatives Committee]] | term_start2 = July 25, 2016 | term_end2 = | predecessor2 = [[Lito Lapid]] | successor2 = | order3 = | office3 = Chair of the [[List of Philippine Senate committees|Philippine Senate
Trade, Commerce and
Entrepreneurship Committee]] | term_start3 = July 25, 2016 | term_end3 = May 25, 2018 | predecessor3 = [[Bam Aquino]] {{small|(as Trade and Commerce)}} | successor3 = [[Aquilino Pimentel III]] | office4 = [[Majority Floor Leader of the Senate of the Philippines]] | term_start5 = November 17, 2008 | term_end5 = June 30, 2010 | predecessor5 = [[Francis Pangilinan]] | successor5 = Vicente Sotto III |term_start4 = May 21, 2018 |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = [[Vicente Sotto III]] |sucessor4 = | order5 = | office6 = Member of the [[House of Representatives of the Philippines|Philippine House of Representatives]] from [[Legislative districts of Bukidnon#Third district|Bukidnon's 3rd District]] | term_start6 = June 30, 1998 | term_end6 = June 30, 2007 | predecessor6 = [[Jose Ma. R. Zubiri, Jr.]] | successor6 = [[Jose Zubiri III|Jose Ma. F. Zubiri III]] | birth_name = Juan Miguel Fernandez Zubiri | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1968|04|13}} | birth_place = [[Makati, Metro Manila]], Philippines | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Filipinos|Filipino]] | party = [[PDP-Laban]] (2016–present) | otherparty = [[Pwersa ng Masang Pilipino|PMP]] (2012–2013)
[[Lakas Kampi CMD|Lakas CMD/Lakas-Kampi CMD]] (1998–2011)
[[Independent (politician)|Independent]] (2011–2012, 2014–2016) | spouse = Audrey Tan | relations = | children = Maria Adriana
Juan Miguel Jr.
Santiago Gabriel | residence = {{bulleted_list|[[Malaybalay City]], [[Bukidnon]] | [[Makati City]] | [[Muntinlupa City]]}} | alma_mater = [[University of the Philippines Los Baños]] | profession = Businessperson | religion = Roman Catholicism | net_worth = [[Philippine peso|₱]]152 million (2017){{cite news |title=Villar richest senator, Trillanes poorest in 2017 |url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/05/17/cynthia-villar-antonio-trillanes-manny-pacquiao-saln-senators-2017.html |accessdate=30 May 2018 |agency=''[[CNN Philippines]]'' |date=17 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180530231456/http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/05/17/cynthia-villar-antonio-trillanes-manny-pacquiao-saln-senators-2017.html |archivedate=30 May 2018}} | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Juan Miguel''' "'''Migz'''" '''Fernández Zubiri''' (born April 13, 1969) is a [[Filipino people|Filipino]] businessman and politician who served three consecutive terms in the [[House of Representatives of the Philippines|Philippine House of Representatives]] for the [[Legislative districts of Bukidnon#Third district|third district of Bukidnon]] and as a senator. In the 14th Congress of the Philippine Senate, he became [[Senate of the Philippines|Senate]] [[Majority Leader]], replacing Senator [[Francis Pangilinan]] on November 17, 2008.[http://www.gmanews.tv/story/133995/Zubiri-is-new-Senate-Majority-Leader gmanews.tv, Zubiri is new Senate Majority Leader] During his Majority Leadership, the Senate passed a record 650 bills.[https://www.pressreader.com/philippines/manila-bulletin/20151229/281685433814679] In the 17th Congress, he was once again elected as Senate Majority Leader on May 21, 2018, filling the vacancy left by elected Senate President [[Vicente Sotto III]].[https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/654076/zubiri-elected-as-senate-majority-leader/story/] He is also the current vice chairman of the Philippine Red Cross.[http://www.redcross.org.ph/board-of-governors] During his first term as senator, Zubiri announced his resignation from the Senate on August 3, 2011, following allegations of poll fraud during the [[Philippine Senate election, 2007|Senate elections]] of 2007.[http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/35661/zubiri-resigns-amid-poll-fraud-scandal Zubiri resigns amid poll fraud scandal | Inquirer News]. Newsinfo.inquirer.net (August 3, 2011). Retrieved on August 13, 2011.[http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/08/03/11/zubiri-give-senate-seat-source Zubiri to give up Senate seat | ABS-CBN News | Latest Philippine Headlines, Breaking News, Video, Analysis, Features]. ABS-CBN News. Retrieved on August 13, 2011.[http://www.gmanews.tv/story/228270/nation/zubiri-resigns-amid-poll-fraud-controversy Senator Zubiri resigns amid 2007 poll fraud controversy – Nation – GMA News Online – Latest Philippine News]. Gmanews.tv. Retrieved on August 13, 2011.[http://interaksyon.com/article/9977/zubiri-resigns Zubiri resigns from Senate] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120320231734/http://interaksyon.com/article/9977/zubiri-resigns |date=March 20, 2012 }}. Interaksyon.com (June 15, 1991). Retrieved on August 13, 2011. ==Personal life== Zubiri was born in [[Makati City]], Philippines to a [[Negrense]] father, [[Jose Zubiri, Jr.|Jose Maria Rubin Zubiri, Jr]]. from [[Kabankalan City]] and a [[Bicolanos|Bicolana]] mother, Maria Victoria Ocampo Fernandez of [[Libon, Albay]] who was raised in the province of [[Bukidnon]] in Mindanao. He speaks [[Cebuano language|Cebuano]], [[Tagalog language|Tagalog]], English, and his father's native [[Hiligaynon language|Hiligaynon]]. His father Jose Maria is the incumbent Bukidnon provincial governor. His family is of partial (patrilineal) [[Basque people|Basque]] and Spanish heritage. ===Notable Positions and Affiliations=== • Governor of the [[Philippine Red Cross]]
• Member, [[Rotary Club]] of Makati
• Governor, Ranchers' Club Philippines 1989– University of the Philippines Los Banos chapterBody Talk with Migz Zubiri | Entertainment, News, The Philippine Star | philstar.com Philstar.com › entertainment › 2013/05/04
• Chairman, Amateur Boxing Association of the Philippines Bukidnon Chapter
• Chairman, Paglaum Foundation
• Member, [[Upsilon Phi Sigma|Upsilon Phi Sigma Fraternity and Sorority]]
• President of the KATALA Foundation
• President of the Philippine Deer Foundation
==Education== Zubiri finished elementary and high school in [[Colegio San Agustin-Makati]]. He graduated from the [[University of the Philippines Los Baños]] with a degree in Bachelor of Science in Agribusiness Management. He also earned a Master of Environment and Natural Resources Management degree from the [[University of the Philippines Open University]]. ==Political career== ===Congress=== After serving as chief of staff of his father, Rep. (now Bukidnon Governor) Jose Ma. R. Zubiri, Jr., from 1995–1998, he ran for the seat representing the [[Legislative districts of Bukidnon#Third district|third district of Bukidnon]] to be vacated by his father in the 1998 general elections. Winning easily in that election, he served his first term in the [[10th Congress of the Philippines|10th Congress]]. During his first term, he was one of the members of what the media dubbed as the "[[Spice Boys (Congressmen)|Spice Boys]]", a group of neophyte and two-term congressmen who were openly critical of President [[Joseph Estrada|Joseph Estrada's]] administration. He was subsequently re-elected to the [[House of Representatives of the Philippines|Philippine House of Representatives]] in the 2001 and 2004 elections. ===Senate=== After serving as a [[Congressman]] for three-terms, he was drafted by [[Lakas–CMD (1991)|Lakas CMD]] to be one of their candidates in the pro [[Gloria Macapagal Arroyo]] administration [[TEAM Unity]] ticket in the 2007 mid-term elections. In the final tally for the 2007 senatorial race by the [[Comelec|Philippine Commission on Elections (Comelec)]], Rep. Zubiri narrowly defeated opposition candidate [[Koko Pimentel]] for the 12th and last slot in the Senate. Zubiri had a total of 11,001,730 votes against Pimentel's 10,983,358 votes.[http://www.tribune.net.ph/headlines/20070714hed3.html The Philippine Daily Tribune] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070715140200/http://www.tribune.net.ph/headlines/20070714hed3.html |date=July 15, 2007 }} The margin of some 18,372 votes was hotly contested, particularly the votes from the southern Philippine province of [[Maguindanao]], where Pimentel had lost heavily to Zubiri. Claiming the votes in [[Maguindanao]] were tainted,[http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/storypage.aspx?StoryId=82880 ABS-CBN News] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070701205304/http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/storypage.aspx?StoryId=82880 |date=July 1, 2007 }} Pimentel petitioned the [[Supreme Court of the Philippines|Philippine Supreme Court]] to invalidate the votes from Maguindanao, effectively disenfranchising a whole province. The Supreme Court voted unanimously 14 -0 against Pimentel and allowed the COMELEC (Commission on Elections) to count the votes in Zubiri's favor. Pimentel then returned to the Supreme Court for the second time. This time, he petitioned the justices to issue a restraining order against the proclamation of Zubiri. After oral arguments, however, the High Tribunal again voted to uphold the COMELEC's decision to proclaim Zubiri, consequently failing to grant Pimentel's petition.[http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view_article.php?article_id=76486 Inquirer.net, SC paves way for Zubiri proclamation] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070715122235/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view_article.php?article_id=76486 |date=July 15, 2007 }}. None. Retrieved on August 13, 2011. The next day, July 14, 2007, Zubiri was duly proclaimed elected to the [[Senate of the Philippines|Philippine Senate]]. However, the Court's judgment did not prevent Pimentel from bringing his poll protests to the Senate Electoral Tribunal. On March 14, 2008, the Supreme Court, in a 40-page decision penned by Associate Justice [[Minita Chico-Nazario]], dismissed [[Koko Pimentel]] petition to stop the Commission on Elections from canvassing votes from the province of [[Maguindanao]],[http://www.gmanews.tv/story/84882/Zubiri-SC-decision-a-big-morale-booster www.gmanews.tv, Zubiri: SC decision a big morale booster]. Gmanews.tv. Retrieved on August 13, 2011. a definite morale booster for Senator Zubiri. While serving his stint in the Senate, Zubiri began advocating a more in-depth study of biofuels in order to prevent food shortages, all the while allowing current production of alternative clean energy and biofuels so as to lessen dependence on imported oil and allow the Philippine economy a new avenue of economic success, "especially in this day and age of constant rising oil prices".[http://www.philstar.com/archives.php?aid=2008040233&type=2 – Philstar.com- Food vs. Fuel issue not applicable to RP]{{dead link|date=August 2011}} On August 3, 2011, however, during his privilege speech on the floor in the [[Senate of the Philippines|Philippine Senate]], Zubiri suddenly announced his resignation from the body. In his speech, he said that his family was hurt by the "unfounded" accusations against him. "Without admitting any fault and with my vehement denial of the alleged electoral fraud hurled against me, I am submitting my resignation as a duly elected Senator of the Republic of the Philippines in the election for which I am falsely accused without mercy and compassion," Zubiri said in his speech. "My political detractors began calling me ugly names and dragging the name of my family in entirety. In other words, Mr. President, the trial by publicity has begun," he continued. His resignation was lauded by [[Malacañang Palace|Malacañang]] and various sectorshttp://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/228270/news/nation/senator-zubiri-resigns-amid-2007-poll-fraud-controversyhttp://balita.ph/2011/08/03/enrile-commends-zubiri-resignation-saddened-colleagues but was also seen as a step that helped restore the Filipino's faith in national electoral protests. Senator [[Francis Pangilinan]], a member of the Senate Electoral Tribunal, likewise refused to comment on what the next procedure is for the vacancy left by Zubiri. "Let's just wait for developments if any," he said.[http://ph.news.yahoo.com/senator-zubiri-resigning-from-post-.html Senator Zubiri resigns from post, to run in 2013 – Yahoo!]. Ph.news.yahoo.com (August 3, 2011). Retrieved on August 13, 2011. In 2016, he ran for the senate under the Partido ng Galing at Puso of Senator [[Grace Poe]]'s [[Grace Poe presidential campaign, 2016|presidential campaign]] placing 6th in the polls. As like other politicians, he left his party and joined [[PDP–Laban]], mending his relations with Koko Pimentel, his former adversary. ==Ancestry== {{ahnentafel |collapsed=yes |align=center |title=Ancestors of Juan Miguel Zubiri |boxstyle_1=background-color: #fcc; |boxstyle_2=background-color: #fb9; |boxstyle_3=background-color: #ffc; |boxstyle_4=background-color: #bfc; |boxstyle_5=background-color: #9fe; |1. Juan Miguel Zubiri |2. [[Jose Maria Zubiri, Jr.]] |3. Maria Victoria Fernandez |4. Jose Zubiri, Sr. |5. Rosa Rubin |6. Manuel Fernandez |7. Rosita Ocampo | | | | |12. Bartolomé Fernández |13. Pilar Calleja |14. Jesús Ocampo |15. Rosenda Villaroman | | | | | | | | |24. Manuel Fernández |25. Mamerta Seda |26. Ignacio Calleja |27. Aquilina Maronilla |28. ? Ocampo
(''first name unidentified'') |29. ?
(''first and last name unidentified'') | | }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070602203229/http://migzzubiri.org/index.php Juan Miguel "Migz" F. Zubiri's Official Website] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20140527115514/http://www.senate.gov.ph/ Official Website of the Senate of the Philippines] {{S-start}} {{succession box | before= [[Francis Pangilinan]] | title= [[Majority leader of the Senate of the Philippines]] | years= 2008–2010 | after= [[Vicente Sotto III]] }} {{succession box | before= [[Jose Ma. Zubiri III]] }} {{S-end}} {{PhilSenMajority}} {{navboxes |title = Senatorial history of Juan Miguel Zubiri |list= {{14th Congress of the Philippines senators}} {{15th Congress of the Philippines senators}} {{17th Congress of the Philippines senators}} }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zubiri, Juan Miguel}} [[Category:Filipino businesspeople]] [[Category:Filipino Roman Catholics]] [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:University of the Philippines Los Baños alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Visayan people]] [[Category:Bicolano politicians]] [[Category:Filipino people of Spanish descent]] [[Category:People from Bacolod]] [[Category:People from Bukidnon]] [[Category:Lakas–CMD politicians]] [[Category:Majority leaders of the Senate of the Philippines]] [[Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Philippines from Bukidnon]] [[Category:Senators of the 17th Congress of the Philippines]] [[Category:Senators of the 15th Congress of the Philippines]] [[Category:Senators of the 14th Congress of the Philippines]] [[Category:United Nationalist Alliance politicians]] [[Category:University of the Philippines Open University alumni]]

[[Orrin H. Ingram II]] (great-great=great-nephew)
[[John R. Ingram (businessman)|John R. Ingram]] (great-great-great-nephew) }} '''Julius G. Ingram''' (May 31, 1832 – May 13, 1917) was a member of the [[Wisconsin State Assembly]]. ==Early life== Julius Ingram was born on May 31, 1832 in [[Saratoga County, New York]].{{cite news|title=J. G. Ingram Dies; Pioneer Resident |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/5449042/julius_ingram_18321917/|newspaper=Eau Claire Leader |date=May 13, 1917|page=2|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = June 1, 2016}} {{Open access}}{{cite book|title=THE BLUE BOOK OF THE STATE OF WISCONSIN|edition=18th|location=Madison, Wis.|publisher=David Atwood|year=1879|page=491}} His brother, [[Orrin Henry Ingram]], was a lumber baron.{{cite book|editor=George Forrester|year=1892|title=HISTORICAL AND BIOGRAPHICAL ALBUM OF THE CHIPPEWA VALLEY WISCONSIN|location=Chicago, Illinois|publisher=A. Warner|pages=417–418}} ==Career== Ingram was a member of the Assembly in 1878 and 1879.{{cite news|title=Wisconsin Legislature of 1878 |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/5437784/wisconsin_legislature_of_1878/|newspaper=Oshkosh Daily Northwestern |date=November 15, 1877|page=2|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 31, 2016}} {{Open access}} He was a [[Republican Party of Wisconsin|Republican]]. Ingram served on the board of trustees of the Eau Claire asylum.{{cite news|title=Julius Ingram Was Re-Elected |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/5437716/julius_ingram_18321917/|newspaper=Eau Claire Leader |date=November 13, 1908|page=2|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 31, 2016}} {{Open access}} ==Personal life== He first married Mary Linda Van Wagenen. They had three children before her death on September 13, 1879. Ingram later married Ella Moffat on June 24, 1886. They had one child. Ingram was a Congregationalist. ==Death and legacy== Ingram died at his home on May 13, 1917. He was buried at the [[Lake View Cemetery (Eau Claire, Wisconsin)|Lake View Cemetery]], [[Eau Claire, Wisconsin]], U.S. His nephew, [[Erskine B. Ingram]], became a high-profile businessman. His descendants are the owners of [[Ingram Industries]] and its subsidiaries, which include [[Ingram Barge Company]], [[Ingram Content Group]], [[Ingram Entertainment Holdings Inc.]], [[Ingram Micro]] and [[Lightning Source]]. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Find a Grave|62922570}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ingram, Julius}} [[Category:1832 births]] [[Category:1917 deaths]] [[Category:People from Saratoga County, New York]] [[Category:Politicians from Eau Claire, Wisconsin]] [[Category:American Congregationalists]] [[Category:19th-century Congregationalists]] [[Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly]] [[Category:Wisconsin Republicans]] [[Category:Ingram family]] [[Category:Burials in Wisconsin]] [[Category:19th-century American politicians]]

{{coord|32.7745799|-96.801484|format=dms|display=title|region:US_type:landmark}} [[File:Palacio de Convenciones en Dallas.jpg|thumb|Exterior]] [[Image:Dallas Convention Center.png|thumb|right|Aerial overview of the complex]] The '''Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center''' (originally the '''Dallas Memorial Auditorium''' and formerly '''Dallas Convention Center''') is a [[convention center]] in the [[Convention Center District, Dallas, Texas|Convention Center District]] of [[downtown Dallas|downtown]] [[Dallas, Texas|Dallas]], [[Texas]]. The original Dallas Memorial Auditorium was designed by [[George Dahl]] in 1957. It holds approximately 10,000 seats. Dahl was responsible for the renowned Art Deco buildings at the Dallas [[Fair Park]], as well as many other Texas landmarks. The Convention Center additions were designed by [[Larry Oltmanns]], who was a Design Partner with [[Skidmore, Owings and Merrill]] at the time.
== About == The center is over {{convert|2000000|sqft|m2}} in size and contains over {{convert|1000000|sqft|m2}} of exhibit space. The largest contiguous exhibit space in the structure is {{convert|726726|sqft|m2|0}}. A {{convert|203000|sqft|m2}} column-free exhibit hall in the center is the largest of its kind in the [[United States]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.businessreviewusa.com/leadership/3679/Top-Ten-US-Convention-Centers|title=Top Ten U.S. Convention Centers|website=www.businessreviewusa.com|access-date=2017-05-03}}</ref> It is annually used for the Dallas Auto Show.<ref name="dcc_facility_overview">[http://www.dallasconventioncenter.com/ Dallas Convention Center] - [http://www.dallasconventioncenter.com/facility/faco.asp Facility Overview]. Retrieved on 29 August 2006.</ref>
The east side of the structure contains the original element of the Dallas Memorial Auditorium, a 9,816-seat [[Dallas Convention Center Arena|arena]]. The complex also houses a 1,740-person [[theater]], 105 meeting rooms, and 2 gigantic [[ballroom]]s. In terms of accessibility, the world's largest [[heliport]]/[[vertiport]] sits atop the structure and 75 truck [[Berth (moorings)|berth]]s line its docks.<ref name="dcc_facility_overview"/> The [[Dallas CBD Vertiport]], located at the south end of the complex, has two 60 x 60 ft. (18 x 18 m) [[concrete]] [[helipad]]s<ref name="FAA">{{FAA-airport|ID=49T|use=PU|own=PU|site=site=23925.*H}}. Federal Aviation Administration. Effective 26 April 2018.</ref> and {{convert|169000|sqft|m2}} of flight deck, and is capable of handling [[tiltrotor]] aircraft such as the [[Bell Boeing V-22 Osprey]].<ref name=vertiport>{{cite web | url = http://www.dallasexecairport.com/vertiport/ | title = Dallas Executive Airport - Dallas CBD Heliport/Vertiport | publisher = [[Dallas Executive Airport]] | accessdate = 6 May 2018}}</ref>
In May 2009, voters approved construction of the [[Omni Dallas Convention Center Hotel]], a 1,000 room hotel that is attached to the Convention Center. It opened in late 2011, under budget and ahead of schedule.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.dmagazine.com/publications/d-magazine/2012/january/checking-in-the-omni-dallas-convention-center-hotel/|title=Checking In (And Checking Out) the Omni Dallas Hotel - D Magazine|work=D Magazine|access-date=2017-05-03|language=en-US}}</ref>
== History == The Dallas Memorial Auditorium was originally constructed in 1957 near the intersection of Canton and Akard Streets. While the auditorium still hosts many smaller events, its antiquated facilities and technology, along with the fact that it is not compliant with the [[Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990|Americans with Disabilities Act]], have kept it less busy than in the past.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://cityhallblog.dallasnews.com/2016/06/dallas-memorial-auditorium-was-good-enough-for-the-beatles-jfk-and-led-zeppelin-so-why-not-us-2.html/|title=Dallas’ Memorial Auditorium was good enough for the Beatles, JFK and Led Zeppelin, so why not us?|last=Wilonsky|first=Robert|access-date=2016-06-29}}</ref> In the 1970s, the center was expanded and renamed the Dallas Convention Center; the expansion was designed by local architects [[Omniplan (architects)|Omniplan]]. The center was expanded again in 1984 and once more in 1994,<ref name="dcc_history">[http://www.dallasconventioncenter.com/ Dallas Convention Center] - [http://www.dallasconventioncenter.com/info/history.asp History]. Retrieved on 29 August 2006.</ref> when [[Dallas Area Rapid Transit]] constructed the [[Convention Center Station (DART)|Convention Center Station]] underneath the west-wing of the facility, connecting it to the {{DART R|style=nl}} and {{DART B|style=nl}} [[light rail]] lines. The most-recent addition to the facility was completed in 2002.<ref name="dcc_history"/> The complex was renamed in honor of former [[United States Senate|US Senator]] [[Kay Bailey Hutchison]] in 2013.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://keranews.org/post/dallas-convention-center-named-ex-sen-hutchison|title=Dallas Convention Center Named For Ex-Sen. Hutchison|last=Austin|first=BJ|access-date=2016-06-29}}</ref>
[[File:View from Reunion Tower August 2015 11.jpg|thumb|The Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center as viewed from [[Reunion Tower]] in August 2015]]
=== Notable tenants and events === The venue was once home of the [[Dallas Chaparrals]]/[[Texas Chaparrals]] of the [[American Basketball Association]], who played in Dallas from the 1967-68 season through the 1972-73 season. The team moved to San Antonio in 1973 and became the [[San Antonio Spurs]].<ref>http://www.remembertheaba.com/Dallas-Chaparrals.html</ref>
On August 22, 1973, [[The Jackson 5]] held a concert in the auditorium.<ref name=":0" /> While on a five city tour in the final week of 1976, [[Elvis Presley]] performed at the Dallas Convention Center on December 28. The concert was recorded and later released on the Follow That Dream collectors label with the title of ''Showtime!'' On April 1, 1977, [[Led Zeppelin]] opened what would become their last ever American tour together in the Dallas Memorial Auditorium, their sixth time performing at the venue.<ref name=":0" /> In October 1978, [[Queen (band)|Queen]] played at the Convention Center during their US tour, and the music video for "[[Fat Bottomed Girls]]" was filmed at the center.<ref>[http://www.ultimatequeen.co.uk/videos/queenpromo.htm Queen Promo Videos - Fat Bottomed Girls] Ultimate Queen. Retrieved 4 September 2011</ref> [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] had two concerts at the venue: once in 1981 and again in 2000.<ref name=":0" /> Other performers who held concerts here include: [[Madonna_(entertainer)|Madonna]], [[James Brown]], [[The Beatles]], [[The Rolling Stones]], [[The Who]], [[Jimi Hendrix]], [[The Doors]], [[Grateful Dead]], [[Black Sabbath]], [[Bruce Springsteen]], [[David Bowie]], [[Billy Joel]], and [[Elvis Costello]].<ref name=":0" />
Together with [[Reunion Arena]], the center was an emergency shelter for thousands of [[Hurricane Katrina]] refugees in September 2005.
Beginning in 2014, the center became the venue for [[Fan Expo Dallas]].<ref name="cbs140518">{{cite news|last1=New|first1=Brian|title=Record-Breaking Attendance Recorded At Dallas Comic Con|url=http://dfw.cbslocal.com/2014/05/18/record-breaking-attendance-recorded-at-dallas-comic-con/|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=CBS DFW|publisher=KTVT-11|date=May 18, 2014}}</ref>
From March 31 to April 3, 2016, [[WWE]] hosted the professional wrestling convention WWE Axxess at the center. On Friday, April 1, WWE held [[NXT TakeOver: Dallas]] in the auditorium. The events were all part of [[WrestleMania 32|WrestleMania]] week in the [[Dallas–Fort Worth metroplex]] area.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/WrestleMania-Fever-Hits-North-Texas-374199871.html|title=WrestleMania Fever Hits North Texas|access-date=2016-06-29}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}

'''Cornelis ("Kees") Bruynzeel''' (February 19, 1900 in [[Rotterdam]] – 1980) was a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] [[businessman]], [[timber]] [[merchant]] and [[yachtsman]].
==Early years== Bruynzeel was the son of Cornelis Bruynzeel Sr., who founded a timber factory in 1897, and Antoinette Lels. He studied in [[The Hague]], and took several trips to the United States and Sweden to study progress in automatization and wood manufacturing. In 1920 he became manager of the family's new door factory in [[Zaandam]]. In 1922 he married Titia Verkade, granddaughter of the industrialist [[Ericus Verkade|Ericus Gerhardus Verkade]].
Bruynzeel Jr. was an avid sailor. He won the [[Fastnet race]] for the [[Netherlands]] in 1937 with his [[Sparkman & Stephens|Stephens-designed]] [[yawl]] ''Zeearend'' ("sea eagle", the eagle being the logo of the Bruynzeel company). The Dutch designer [[Piet Zwart]] worked closely with Bruynzeel's father and his brother Willem<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iisg.nl/ondernemers/pdf/pers-0266-02.pdf|title=Biography: Willem Bruynzeel|language=Dutch}}</ref> (he designed their first kitchens) and was involved with the design of the Zeearend as well.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marcuse.nl/foto.php?pageID=157 |title=Piet Zwart, een veelzijdig avant-gardistisch vormgever |language=Dutch }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
==Industry Pioneer== In 1939, when the production had expanded to include floors and kitchens and the threat of [[World War II]] was causing a decline in the building industry, he considered alternatives and pioneered the development of new timber materials for the production of the Bruynzeel kitchen<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nai.nl/e/collection/news/2004/0405_bruynzeel_e.html |title=Model by Bruynzeel: Design your own kitchen |publisher=Netherlands Architecture Institute |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060724120633/http://www.nai.nl/e/collection/news/2004/0405_bruynzeel_e.html |archivedate=2006-07-24 |df= }}</ref> and for boat construction. Using a newly developed water-resistant synthetic resin glue, Bruynzeel developed a durable three-ply wood, similar to [[plywood]], for the fabrication of external doors. Bruynzeel went on to extend the concept of the modular kitchen and with [[E.G. van de Stadt]] developed the first industrialised boat construction system in the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.valkenklasse.nl/nieuws/newsarch.htm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050426210812/http://www.valkenklasse.nl/nieuws/newsarch.htm |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2005-04-26 |title=Valkenklasse |language=Dutch }}</ref>
Today Bruynzeel Multipanel Int. B.V., as it was later renamed, is a leading timber company that specialises in [[Marine (ocean)|marine]] and [[construction]] timber, with distribution throughout [[Europe]], [[North America]] and the [[Caribbean]], amongst others. The Bruynzeel name also lives on as a [[shelf (storage)|shelving]] brand of the Norwegian [[Constructor Group AS|Constructor Group]].
==South Africa== In 1956 Kees Bruynzeel Jr. moved to [[South Africa]], where he owned and operated a company [[Bruply Doors]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.icpcredit.com/ReportRequest.asp?sCompanyID=306988|title=Bruply Doors (Pty) Ltd.}}</ref> including a factory at [[Stellenbosch]]. Bruynzeel's South African timber operations now comprise [[PG Bison]] and are controlled by Steinhoff Africa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.steinhoffinternational.com/asp/africa_operations.asp|title=PG Bison and Steinhoff Africa}}</ref>
In 1962, Bruynzeel built a house in [[Stellenbosch]], that was controversial considering the conservative architecture of the time. The roof of the house is shaped like a [[hyperbolic paraboloid]], and is constructed using [[teak]] [[rafter]]s and lined with [[Afrocarpus|yellowwood]]. It was [[design]]ed by [[architect]] [[Aart Bijl]].
==Sailing== Bruynzeel continued sailing and winning races. In the 1937 Fastnet Race "Zeearend" was winner overall. In the Fastnet 1951 Race, "Zeevalk" wasklasse winner and 2. overall. "Stormvogel" was first to finish in the 61 Fastnet, the 62 Buenos Aires-Rio race, the 64 Burmuda race, the Sydney-Hobart, the China Sea, and the 1967 Trans-Pacific Race (Los Angeles-to-Hawaii [[Transpacific Yacht Race|Transpac]] race with the boat ''Stormvogel'' ("Stormbird" or the ''[[Procellariidae|Shearwater]]''), after coming in a close second in 1965.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.transpacificyc.org/history/tp03-lists.html |title=The Transpac Race at www.transpacificyc.org |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060504022510/http://www.transpacificyc.org/history/tp03-lists.html |archivedate=2006-05-04 |df= }}</ref> In 1973, aged 72, Bruynzeel took both line and overall handicap honours in the [[Cape to Rio Yacht Race]] in his boat ''Stormy'';<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rorc.org/admiralscup/history/1957/default.html|title=Excerpt from ''The Admiral's Cup'' by Bob Fisher|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060427205526/http://www.rorc.org/admiralscup/history/1957/default.html|archivedate=2006-04-27|df=}}</ref> his progress was followed with keen interest, since he had suffered three [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]]s in the previous year.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://sparkmanstephens.blogspot.nl/2011/05/design-126-zeearend.html Sparkman&Stephens Design 126 - Zeearend] * [http://www.landmarkhouse.com/ Details and photos of the Bruynzeel house] * [http://www.stellenboschwriters.com/bijla.html Aart Bijl, the architect of Bruynzeel house] * [http://www.stellenboschwriters.com/pPages/1.html Photo of SY Stormvogel] * [http://www.bruynzeelmultipanel.com/ Bruynzeel Multipanel Int. B.V. website] * [http://www.steinhoffinternational.com Steinhoff International Limited website] * [http://people.zeelandnet.nl/kooiman70/Hendrik%20Salomons.htm#III.4 C de Haas & Brijnzeel 1870]{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Company established by grandparents

{{Infobox person |name = Kurt Jetta |image = |image_size = |alt = |caption = |birth_name = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|7|21|mf=yes}} |birth_place = |residence = |alma_mater = [[Fordham University]], [[Duke University]], [[North Carolina State University]] |occupation = Consumer Analyst |years_active = 1998–present |net_worth = |boards = |religion = |spouse = |children = |parents = |signature = |signature_alt= |website = }} [[File:5C2A0752.jpg|thumb|Dr. Kurt Jetta Ph.D.]] '''Kurt Jetta''' (born 21 July 1961) is a [[consumer research]]er who studies data about [[multinational corporation]]s through his firm, TABS Analytics, which is based in [[Shelton, Connecticut]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.northjersey.com/news/business/facing-back-to-school-test-1.1054266?page=all|title=Retailers sharpening their pencils for back-to-school test - Business - NorthJersey.com|last=Verdon|first=Joan|date=20 July 2014|publisher=[[North Jersey Media Group]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=Consumer-products manufacturers and retailers have found that when you run seasonal promotions early, "it will sell earlier and you get that incremental hit as well," said Kurt Jetta, chief executive and founder of TABS Group, a sales and marketing analytics firm based in Connecticut.}}</ref> The corporations Jetta has analyzed include [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbestechcouncil/2017/06/30/the-e-commerce-paradox-brick-and-mortar-killer-or-is-it/#5c72191c7736|title=The E-Commerce Paradox: Brick-And-Mortar Killer...Or Is It?|last=Council|first=Editors, Forbes Technology|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en}}</ref> [[Family Dollar]],<ref name=Hadley/> [[Dollar Tree]],<ref name=Hadley>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/business/2014/07/29/dollar-tree-family-dollar-strategy-impact/13314805/|title=Dollar store merger means more competition|first=Hadley|last=Malcolm|date=29 July 2014|publisher=[[USA Today]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=Now Family Dollar stands to benefit from Dollar Tree's management expertise while maintaining and bolstering its brand, and other discounters like Dollar General and even Walmart could see sales falter. "If Dollar Tree can bring their magic over to Family Dollar, it's going to have a pretty significant impact on this overall sector," says Kurt Jetta, CEO of TABS Group, a consumer analytics firm.}}</ref> [[Walmart]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.myfoxtwincities.com/story/17596349/walmart-to-start-sharing-sales-data|title=Walmart To Start Sharing Sales Data|date=4 February 2012|publisher=[[Fox News]]|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref><ref name=James>{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2012/02/04/walmart-to-start-sharing-its-sales-data/|title=Walmart to start sharing its sales data|last=Covert|first=James|date=4 February 2012|publisher=[[New York Post]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=Walmart’s stubborn insistence on keeping its data secret, even as other chains shared theirs through groups like NPD, has had an increasingly isolating effect on the company, says Kurt Jetta, CEO of TABS Group, a consumer research firm.}}</ref> [[Apple Inc.|Apple]],<ref name=Friedman>{{cite web|url=http://www.macworld.com/article/1168261/when_using_apple_stores_easypay_isnt_so_easy.html|quote=Kurt Jetta, the CEO and founder of consumer analytics company TABS Group, told Macworld that when stores add customer-driven point of sale (POS) options like EasyPay, “in general, what happens is that there’s a fairly significant surge in sales” at first, due to the novelty of the new system. That’s then followed by some “shakeout of people that don’t like it for a lot of reasons—user difficulty, user error, and the like.” In the end, Jetta says, sales numbers balance out. Echoing Ciabarra, Jetta pointed out that such systems reduce cost to the retailer, and stores usually see “a significant customer satisfaction uptick” from customers who place value on self-checkout, particularly in terms of customer loyalty. Like Ciabarra, Jetta says he is “suspicious” of Shine’s story. “The assumption,” Jetta said, is that if a customer tries to leave the store with unpurchased items, “is operator error or oversight … Apple wouldn’t want to make it the norm that they’re harassing and jacking up all the people going to the stores. That doesn’t help anybody.”|title=When using Apple Store's EasyPay isn't so easy|last=Friedman|first=Lex|date=7 March 2012|publisher=[[Macworld]]|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref> [[Kmart]],<ref name=Covert>{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2014/05/22/lamperts-sears-remedies-are-masquerade/|title=Lampert’s Sears remedies are a masquerade|last=Covert|first=James|date=22 May 2014|publisher=[[New York Post]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=But “Shop Your Way” — whose rewards points program typically gives discounts amounting to 1 percent — represents backward, outdated thinking, says Kurt Jetta, CEO of TABS Group, a retail consultant focused on pricing and merchandise issues. “Sears and Kmart are so hurting for shoppers that anything they do to hurt one customer is bad, but they’re doing it en masse,” Jetta said.}}</ref> [[JcPenney]],<ref name=Penney>{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2013/03/27/jcpenney-ceo-flip-flops-again-on-prices/|title=JCPenney CEO flip-flops again on prices|last=Covert|first=James|date=27 March 2013|publisher=[[New York Post]]|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref> and [[Sears]].<ref name=Covert/> In addition, Jetta has also studied the [[organic food]] industry,<ref name=Linn>{{cite web|url=http://www.today.com/money/organic-sales-shifting-regular-grocery-stores-6C9678186|title=Organic sales shifting to regular grocery stores|last=Linn|first=Allison|date=12 January 2011|work=[[CNBC]]|publisher=[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=The percentage of people who buy organic products has stayed virtually the same for the past few years, according to a new survey out Wednesday from TABS Group. Kurt Jetta, president of TABS Group, said in an e-mail that his research also hasn’t shown evidence that people who buy organic are buying significantly more products.}}</ref> the [[vitamin]] industry,<ref name=Neff>{{cite web|url=http://adage.com/article/cmo-strategy/study-leaves-vitamin-industry-needing-pick/294603/|title=Study Leaves Vitamin Industry Needing Pick-Me-Up|last=Neff|first=Jack|date=18 August 2014|publisher=[[Advertising Age]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=Kurt Jetta, CEO of the Tabs Group, an analytics firm that recently completed its seventh annual study of the vitamin business, sees an "overall lethargy" in the business this year that he attributes to the negative effects from the studies. Mr. Jetta still projects overall growth of 3% to 4% for 2014 in a business he pegs at $11.4 billion in all channels, although he is leaning more toward low end of that range, well below high-single or even double-digit growth rates in years past. The effect is most noticeable on the segment targeted by the study -- multivitamins -- he said. That's in line with prior studies in the past decade that put the kibosh on beta-carotene and vitamin E, yet seems to be having a broader effect than the decline of those businesses had. "Typically the negativity is isolated only on the one product," Mr. Jetta said. "But this one seems to be a bit broader and brought an overall malaise to the category."}}</ref> and the online grocery industry. Other investigations led by Jetta include [[sociological research]] that pertains to the purchasing habits of various ethnic groups.<ref name=Zetlin>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxbusiness.com/personal-finance/2012/05/14/latest-privacy-invasion-retailer-tracking/|title=The Latest Privacy Invasion: Retailer Tracking|last=Zetlin|first=Minda|date=16 May 2012|publisher=[[Fox News]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote="The most important thing that data is used for is to determine which products consumers prefer, and to make sure what's on the shelf is what they want to buy," explains Kurt Jetta, CEO of TABS Group, a consumer analytics company in Shelton, Conn. "For example, we're doing one project for a retail chain where we found that in areas with high African-American populations, not only do they buy African-American hair care products and cosmetics specifically, but they buy grooming products in general at a very high level. With that kind of information, the retailer can make sure all those products are stocked and available for them."}}</ref> In the area of [[trade promotion (marketing)|trade promotion]], Jetta has developed an alternative methodology to current industry baseline models.<ref>{{cite web|url=|title=Method and system for estimating base sales volume of a product|last=Kolandaiswamy|first=Antony Arokia Durai Raj|author2=Kanagasabapathi Balasubramanian|date=22 December 2011|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=The method includes receiving sales data of the product from one or more sales data sources. Further, the method includes identifying a plurality of independent variables from the received sales data and substituting them in a regression model to calculate a total sales volume of the product. Furthermore, the method includes modifying one or more independent variables of the plurality of independent variables in the regression model to obtain the base sales volume of the product. The base sales volume of the product is the same as the calculated total sales volume when the base sales volume obtained after modifying the one or more independent variables is either negative or greater than the total sales volume.}}</ref> Jetta also analyzes [[rewards program]]s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chiefexecutive.net/ceos-weigh-fix-troubled-company|title=CEOs Weigh in on How to Fix a Troubled Company|last=Buss|first=Dale|date=25 July 2014|publisher=[[Chief Executive (magazine)|Chief Executive]]|accessdate=27 August 2014|quote=Kurt Jetta, CEO of the TABS consumer metrics company, believes that Sears’ emphasis on its “Shop Your Way” loyalty program—which accounted for 74 percent of sales during the fiscal first quarter, up from 68 percent a year earlier—is only “doubling down on a fatally flawed program.”}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2014/05/22/lamperts-sears-remedies-are-masquerade/|title=Lampert’s Sears remedies are a masquerade|last=Covert|first=James|date=22 May 2014|publisher=[[New York Post]]|accessdate=27 August 2014|quote=But “Shop Your Way” — whose rewards points program typically gives discounts amounting to 1 percent — represents backward, outdated thinking, says Kurt Jetta, CEO of TABS Group, a retail consultant focused on pricing and merchandise issues.}}</ref> He is a Republican candidate in Florida’s 21st Congressional District.
==Career==
Between 1996 and 1998 he held a position as Chief Executive Officer of Binky-Griptight, Inc. Binky-Griptight is a supplier of infant products. Prior to Binky-Griptight, Jetta spent seven years at Playtex Products.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://issuu.com/thewagmag/docs/fair_031615|title=Fairfield County Business Journal 031615|work=Issuu|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en}}</ref>
In 1998, Jetta founded TABS Group, where he is the Chief Executive Officer and Lead Product Developer. TABS Group provides marketing analysis for clients in the Consumer Products industry. Additionally, he serves as an independent Director for JM Global Holding, Co.<ref name=Reuters>[https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/officerProfile?symbol=WYIGU.PH&officerId=2624225 JM Global Holding Co] Reuters. Retrieved Sept. 28, 2015</ref> Work by Jetta and TABS has been quoted in The New York Times,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/21/business/ap-files-for-bankruptcy-and-aims-to-sell-120-stores.html|title=A&P Files for Bankruptcy and Aims to Sell 120 Stores|last=Abrams|first=Rachel|date=2015-07-20|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> Forbes,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/bryanpearson/2016/10/28/how-to-improve-online-grocery-learning-from-kroger-walmart/#21d8a67d38fc|title=How To Improve Online Grocery: Learning From Kroger, Walmart|last=Pearson|first=Bryan|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en}}</ref> Bloomberg,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloombergquint.com/business/2017/09/11/whole-foods-deal-boosts-amazon-s-online-grocery-sales-too|title=Amazon Sells More Beans, Turkey Online Thanks to Whole Foods|work=Bloomberg Quint|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en}}</ref> and other national media.
==Consumer trends== Between 2009 and 2012, Jetta [[sample size|sampled]] 1,000 individuals who were aged 18–75 in order to study "their buying habits when it comes to organic products."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesunion.com/living/article/Organics-overhyped-but-on-the-rise-study-says-3389397.php|title=Organics overhyped, but on the rise, study says|last=Fischer|first=Eileen|date=7 March 2012|publisher=[[Times Union (Albany)|Times Union]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=During the last four years, Jetta has been conducting national surveys of 1,000 consumers, ages 18 to 75, using a different group each year, to find out their buying habits when it comes to organic products.}}</ref> Kurt Jetta's research, with regard to the [[organic food]] industry, suggests that the "percentage of people who buy organic products has stayed virtually the same for the past few years,"<ref name=Linn/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://seattletimes.com/html/health/2014523715_organic18.html|title=Organic, natural products sell strongly despite recession|last=Stock|first=Sue|date=17 March 2011|publisher=[[Seattle Times]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=Kurt Jetta is president of the TABS Group, a Connecticut consumer research firm. His recent research shows that the percentage of shoppers who bought natural or organic items has remained steady, in the 38 to 39 percent range for the past three years.}}</ref> at the 38-39% range.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/organic-product-consumer-base-holds-steady-volume-shifting-to-mass-market-retailers-113351179.html|title=Organic Product Consumer Base Holds Steady; Volume Shifting to Mass Market Retailers|last=Jetta|first=Kurt|date=12 January 2012|publisher=PRNewswire|quote=For the third straight year, the percentage of US consumers purchasing Organic products has held steady in the 38-39% range, reports Shelton, CT-based marketing research and consulting company, TABS Group, Inc.|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref> The study found that "Fresh Fruits continues to be the highest penetration category for Organics with 27% of consumers. This is followed by Fresh Vegetables (26%), Eggs (17%), Milk (16%), Chicken (13%), Skincare (7%), Red Meat (6%), Frozen Vegetables (6%), Haircare (5%), Frozen Fruit (4%), Ice Cream (4%), and Cosmetics (3%). Skincare and Haircare are the only two categories that registered consecutive years of annual gains, while Milk and Ice Cream showed declines in consecutive years."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/organic-product-consumer-base-holds-steady-volume-shifting-to-mass-market-retailers-113351179.html|title=Organic Product Consumer Base Holds Steady; Volume Shifting to Mass Market Retailers|last=Jetta|first=Kurt|date=12 January 2012|publisher=PRNewswire|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref> Jetta and his firm have also found that due to negative studies concerning [[multivitamins]], the vitamin industry saw an "overall lethargy" in 2014.<ref name=Neff/>
Jetta has stated that "The most important thing that data is used for is to determine which products consumers prefer, and to make sure what's on the shelf is what they want to buy...For example, we're doing one project for a retail chain where we found that in areas with high African-American populations, not only do they buy African-American hair care products and cosmetics specifically, but they buy grooming products in general at a very high level. With that kind of information, the retailer can make sure all those products are stocked and available for them."<ref name=Zetlin/>
In early 2016, Jetta criticized the consumer packaged goods industry for stalling their own growth. His work, covered by both Wells Fargo and Food Navigator USA, showed that the consumer packaged goods industry focuses too much on less effective promotional tactics such as retailer loyalty programs and marketing to millennials at the expense of doing more traditional consumer trade promotion.<ref name=Kress>Kress, Melissa. [http://www.csnews.com/node/89942 “Misguided Paradigms Plague Today’s Trade Promotions.”] Convenience Store News. April 14, 2016</ref> He has also published opinion articles on the topic.<ref>Jetta, Kurt. [http://www.chaindrugreview.com/ten-ways-cpg-makers-are-shooting-themselves-in-the-foot/ “Ten ways CPG makers are shooting themselves in the foot.”] Chain Drug Review. April 22, 2016</ref><ref name=Watson>Watson, Elaine. [http://www.foodnavigator-usa.com/Manufacturers/Why-is-trade-spending-becoming-less-and-less-effective “Promotional blues: Why is trade spending becoming less and less effective?”] Food Navigator. Nov. 16, 2015</ref>
Also in 2016, Jetta’s research on online purchasing of baby goods by consumers received press when the study revealed that baby products are the largest online market of any of the consumer packaged goods categories studied.<ref name=Baby>[http://www.businessinsider.com/target-walmart-amazon-dominate-the-online-baby-goods-market-2016-4 “Target, Walmart, Amazon dominate the online baby goods market.”] Business Insider. April 22, 2016</ref><ref>Verdon, Joan. [http://www.northjersey.com/news/business/baby-products-booming-online-1.1540354 “New generation moms like to buy for baby online, study finds.”] North Jersey.com April 7, 2016</ref>
Jetta began commenting on the online grocery business in 2016. After a TABS study found that fewer consumers purchased groceries online in 2016 than in 2015, he reported that “online grocery is failing,” and that Amazon would have difficulty breaking into grocery business because consumers enjoy grocery shopping in brick and mortar stores.<ref>Pearson, Bryan. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/bryanpearson/2016/10/28/how-to-improve-online-grocery-learning-from-kroger-walmart/#53c6888738fc “How to Improve Online Grocery: Learning from Kroger, Walmart.”] Forbes. Oct. 28, 2016</ref><ref>Maynard, Micheline. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/michelinemaynard/2016/09/27/is-the-grocery-delivery-business-about-to-run-off-the-road/#775e302577e5 “Is the Grocery Business About to Run Off the Road?”] Forbes. Sept. 27, 2016</ref><ref>Soper, Spencer and Olivia Zaleski. [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2017-03-20/inside-amazon-s-battle-to-break-into-the-800-billion-grocery-market “Inside Amazon’s Battle to Break Into the $800 Billion Grocery Market.”] Bloomberg. March 20, 2017</ref> He also commented on the pricing strategies of Whole Foods, stating that grocery shoppers wanted “deals.”<ref>English, Carleton. [https://nypost.com/2017/04/12/whole-foods-in-need-of-a-major-shakeup/ “Whole Foods in need of a major shakeup.”] New York Post. April 12, 2017</ref> When Amazon announced its intent to purchase Whole Foods in June 2017, Jetta’s research and commentary was quoted in Bloomberg and The Denver Post, and he was interviewed on NPR.<ref>Boyle, Matthew. [http://www.denverpost.com/2017/06/16/bezos-amazon-whole-foods/ “Jeff Bezo’s grocery shopping shakes up an $800 billion industry.”] The Denver Post. June 16, 2017</ref><ref>Soper, Spencer, Emily Biuso, and Nick Turner. [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-06-16/amazon-targets-your-fridge-with-13-7-billion-whole-foods-deal “Amazon Targets Your Fridge with 13.7 Billion Whole Foods Deal.”] Bloomberg. June 16, 2017</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534378678/how-will-things-change-for-shoppers-after-amazon-buys-whole-foods|title=How Will Things Change For Shoppers After Amazon Buys Whole Foods?|work=NPR.org|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en}}</ref>
==Corporation analyses== In July 2014, after [[Dollar Tree]] announced its acquisition bid of [[Family Dollar]], ''[[USA Today]]'' shared Kurt Jetta's prediction that the merger would affect the entire economic [[Sector (economic)|sector]] shared by companies such as Walmart.<ref name=Hadley/> Jetta's TABS Group formed a "senior-level team dedicated to supporting internal and customer-related initiatives with Walmart" and researched the methodology that enables this corporation to operate "on a chain and local level."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/tabs-group-forms-dedicated-wal-mart-analytics-team-to-enhance-insights-at-largest-us-retailer-2013-10-11|title=TABS Group Forms Dedicated Wal-Mart Analytics Team to Enhance Insights at Largest U.S. Retailer|date=13 October 2011|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref> Tying in with his consumer research related to the organic food industry, Jetta et al. found that Walmart suffered in some areas after it "jumped on the organic bandwagon a little too soon".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesunion.com/living/article/Organics-overhyped-but-on-the-rise-study-says-3389397.php|title=Organics overhyped, but on the rise, study says|last=Fischer|first=Eileen|date=7 March 2012|publisher=[[Times Union (Albany)|Times Union]]|accessdate=22 August 2014|quote=Kurt Jetta, founder and chief executive officer of TABS Group Inc. in Shelton, Conn., a company that provides analytics, software and strategic consulting to companies involved in consumer products, began studying consumer attitudes on organic products years ago when retailers came to him asking whether or not they should carry organic products. Their concern came from the fact that some stores jumped on the organic bandwagon a little too soon, Jetta explained, pumping up their inventory with organic products, setting up special displays and then regretting their decisions. "Wal-Mart got into (organics) in a big way and got hurt in a few areas," he said.}}</ref>
He also reviewed Walmart’s change in practice of charging almost all their vendors a stocking fee. Formally the corporation charged these fees sporadically. While a common practice among other retailers, Jetta notes that the change for Walmart, " suggests that they are seeking areas to offset their increased investment in wages, as well as offset their lack of organic revenue growth."<ref>Layne, Natthan. [https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/24/us-wal-mart-stores-suppliers-idUSKBN0P400K20150624 “Wal-Mart to Impose Charges on Suppliers as its Costs Mount.”] Reuters. June 23, 2015</ref>
Additionally, he weighed in on the Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing by retailer chain A&P. He said that the retailer “…has been a dead man walking for 20 years, and the gig is finally up.” Jetta predicts that while one of A&P’s largest creditors might take over some of the stores, many will close and better-managed competitors will purchase the rest.<ref>Covert, James. [https://nypost.com/2015/07/20/historic-grocery-chain-ap-files-for-chapter-11/ “Historic Grocery Chain A&P Files for Chapter 11.”] New York Post. June 20, 2015</ref>
When Ahold NV and Delhaise Group merged to become one of the largest supper market chains in the United States, Jetta noted his approval of the $560 million in savings the companies will incur after just 3 years, was “vital in a flat market.”<ref>Walker, Ian., & Gasparro, A. [http://www.nasdaq.com/article/ahold-delhaize-agree-to-merger--3rd-update-20150624-00968 “Ahold, Delhaize Agree to Merger -- 3rd Update.”] Dow Jones Business News. June 24, 2015</ref>
Jetta also shared his insights about [[Apple Store]]s' EasyPay innovation in [[Macworld]], after a court case was pending about Eric Shine who "was accused of trying to walk out of the Apple Store on New York’s Fifth Avenue without paying for a pair of headphones" although Shine claims that "he did try to pay, using the mobile Apple Store app’s EasyPay option on his phone, but that the purchase didn’t go through."<ref name=Macworld>{{cite web|url=http://www.macworld.com/article/1168261/when_using_apple_stores_easypay_isnt_so_easy.html|quote=Apple’s EasyPay service promises Apple Store shoppers a fast way to conduct business at the company’s retail outlets, letting them buy items without even talking to a store employee. It’s fast and convenient—but one New Jersey teenager claims he got more than he bargained for, after he was accused of trying to walk out of the Apple Store on New York’s Fifth Avenue without paying for a pair of headphones. Eighteen-year-old Eric Shine insists that he did try to pay, using the mobile Apple Store app’s EasyPay option on his phone, but that the purchase didn’t go through. A New York court will hear his case in October.|title=When using Apple Store's EasyPay isn't so easy|last=Friedman|first=Lex|date=7 March 2012|publisher=[[Macworld]]|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref> Jetta stated that 'when stores add customer-driven point of sale (POS) options like EasyPay, “in general, what happens is that there’s a fairly significant surge in sales” at first, due to the novelty of the new system. That’s then followed by some “shakeout of people that don’t like it for a lot of reasons—user difficulty, user error, and the like.”'<ref name="Friedman"/>
Kurt Jetta's research pertaining to Kmart and Sears found that both of their [[rewards program]]s gave discounts of one percent, which Jetta stated, has the effect of hurting their whole [[customer base]].<ref name=Covert/> Jetta has also criticized [[JcPenney]] for what he perceives to be a lack of understanding of trade promotion methodology.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2012/05/31/jcpenney-revives-clearance-events-ceo-previously-likened-to-drugs/|title=JCPenney revives clearance events CEO previously likened to drugs|last=Covert|first=James|date=31 May 2012|publisher=[[New York Post]]|accessdate=27 August 2014|quote=“They’re delusional,” Jetta said of Penney. “They’re not all that much different from other retailers that have had this problem before. They just have a much higher level of hubris about it.”}}</ref>
When grocery chain A&P filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in 2015, Jetta criticized the chain, calling the bankruptcy “a surprise to absolutely no one.”<ref>Moore, Thad. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2015/07/20/ap-was-the-walmart-of-its-day-now-its-filing-for-bankruptcy/ “A&P was ‘the Wal-Mart of its day.’ Now it’s filing for bankruptcy.”] The Washington Post. July 20, 2015</ref> In 2015, Jetta estimated the US supplements industry at $11.8 billion, challenging Nutrition Business Journal’s estimate of over $35 billion as “vastly overstated.”<ref name=Daniells>Daniells, Stephen. [http://www.nutraingredients-usa.com/Markets/Is-the-35-billion-figure-for-the-dietary-supplements-industry-over-inflated “Is the $35 billion figure for the dietary supplements industry over-inflated?”] Nutra Ingredients. Sept. 21, 2015</ref> His statements prompted a rebuttal from Nutrition Business Journal’s Editor-in-Chief and started an ongoing debate.<ref name=Bradley>Bradley, John. [http://www.nutraingredients-usa.com/Markets/NBJ-The-US-supplement-industry-is-37-billion-not-12-billion “NBJ: The US supplement industry is $37 billion, not $12 billion.”] Nutra Ingredients</ref>
==Education== Jetta received his B.S. in Statistics in 1983 from North Carolina State University, where he served as Interfraternity Council President.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://archive.org/details/staterecordnorth1983nort|title=State record North Carolina|last=North Carolina State College|last2=North Carolina State University|last3=North Carolina State College. Catalog|last4=North Carolina State University. Undergraduate catalog|last5=North Carolina State University. Graduate catalog|last6=North Carolina State College. Summer session|last7=North Carolina State University. Summer sessions|last8=North Carolina State College. Directory|last9=North Carolina State University. University directory|date=1957|publisher=Raleigh, N.C. : North Carolina State College|others=NCSU Libraries}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ocr.lib.ncsu.edu/ocr/te/technician-v65n17-1983-10-05/technician-v65n17-1983-10-05.txt|title=North Carolina State University's Student Newspaper Vol LXV Number 17|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> In 1986, he earned his M.B.A. from The Fuqua School of Business at Duke University.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://issuu.com/thewagmag/docs/fair_031615|title=Fairfield County Business Journal 031615|work=Issuu|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en}}</ref>
Nineteen years later, Jetta pursued his Ph.D. In Economics from Fordham University, where he graduated in 2008. His doctoral thesis was titled: A Theory of Retailer Price Promotion Using Economic Foundations: It’s All Incremental, with his central thesis being that the incremental sales generated on a promoted product is entirely incremental to the brand, category and promoting retailer.<ref>Jetta, Kurt. A Theory of A Theory of Retailer Price Promotion Using Economic Foundations: It's All Incremental. Bronx, New York: Fordham University. 2008</ref><ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/544043/1.0_Kurt_Jetta_Folder/Dissertation_Baseline_Paper/KJ_FINAL_Dissertation.pdf?__hstc=102458526.ed51698a6c70ba5008dcfb84ce47968c.1513005643419.1513005643419.1513008039910.2&__hssc=102458526.1.1513099186076&__hsfp=1659602184&hsCtaTracking=f88a33e5-84ee-47c6-9184-570cae709f7a%7Caf011a1d-1d0d-4e10-a45b-c43656aec46c|title=A THEORY OF RETAILER PRICE PROMOTION USING ECONOMIC FOUNDATIONS: IT’S ALL INCREMENTAL|last=Jetta|first=Kurt|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> He published findings from his dissertation in the Journal of Centrum Cathedra and Journal of Research in Marketing.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Jetta|first=Kurt|date=2011|title=A Model to Improve the Estimation of Baseline Retail Sales|url=http://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/544043/Docs/modeltoimprovetheestimationofbaselineretailsales.pdf?t=1513016122999|journal=Journal of CENTRUM Cathedra|volume=4|pages=|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Jetta|first=Kurt|date=August 2016|title=Economic Foundations of Price Promotion: It's All Incremental|url=http://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/544043/1.0_Kurt_Jetta_Folder/JORM_Paper/JORM_Paper_Kurt_Jetta.pdf?t=1513016122999|journal=Journal of Research in Marketing|volume= 6| issue = 2|pages=|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tabsanalytics.com/solutions/tabs-advantage/baseline-sales-calculations-tabs-accubase/|title=Baseline Sales Calculations - TABS AccuBase®|last=Analytics|first=TABS|website=www.tabsanalytics.com|language=en|access-date=2018-01-18}}</ref>
== Political career == Jetta served several years on the Stamford Board of Representatives from 1987-1993. He ran an unsuccessful for the Connecticut House of Representatives in 1988. In October 2017, Jetta declared himself as a Republican candidate for the U.S. House of Representative in Florida’s 21st Congressional District. One of his issues is increased federal focus on the opioid abuse.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://postonpolitics.blog.palmbeachpost.com/2017/11/09/republican-jetta-slams-democrat-frankel-on-opioid-response/|title=Republican Jetta slams Democrat Frankel on opioid response {{!}} Post On Politics|access-date=2018-01-18}}</ref>
== Personal life == Jetta has been married since 1989 to Nancy Jetta from Stamford, CT. He has three adult children.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.kurtjetta.com/about/|title=About - Kurt Jetta|work=Kurt Jetta|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en-US}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== *[http://www.tabsanalytics.com/?__hstc=102458526.9d96da09dc3e4dba8f102375fbf6b07b.1470925260127.1470925260127.1471890435556.2&__hssc=102458526.1.1471890435556&__hsfp=1551434154 TABS Analytics]

{{Infobox newspaper | name = Lancaster Farming | logo = [[Image:Lancfarming1.jpg|right]] | image = | caption = | type = Weekly farm newspaper | format = | owners = [[Steinman Communications, LNP Media Group]] | founder = | publisher = | editor = Stephen Seeber | president = | chiefeditor = | assoceditor = | maneditor = | advertisingdirector = | newseditor = | managingeditordesign = | campuseditor = | campuschief = | opeditor = | sportseditor = | photoeditor = | staff = | foundation = 1955 | political = | language = English | ceased publication = | relaunched = | headquarters = [[Ephrata, Pennsylvania]] | circulation = 60,117 | sister newspapers = | ISSN = | oclc = | website = {{URL|http://www.lancasterfarming.com}} | free = | dirinteractive = }} '''''Lancaster Farming''''' is the leading regional farm newspaper for the [[Northeastern United States|Northeastern]] and [[Mid-Atlantic States|Mid-Atlantic]] [[United States]].
== Description == '''''Lancaster Farming''''' has published weekly on Saturday since 1955.<ref name=mk>[http://www.lancasterfarming.com/site/media_kits.html Lancaster Farming media kit]</ref> Paid circulation is about 59,500. The newspaper shares offices and printing facilities with the ''[[Ephrata Review]]'' and ''[[The Lititz Record-Express]]'' at Lancaster County Weeklies Inc.<ref>[http://www.theaustin.com/html/nr-lancaster.html Facilities expansion] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060820200632/http://www.theaustin.com/html/nr-lancaster.html |date=2006-08-20 }}</ref> in [[Ephrata, Pennsylvania]]. Lancaster County Weeklies is owned by Steinman Communications, LNP Media Group, publisher of ''LNP'' newspaper in Lancaster, Pa.
''Lancaster Farming'' provides news, market and commodity reports, and [[agribusiness]] information and includes news about [[4-H]], [[National FFA Organization|FFA]] and fair events, and rural life.<ref>[http://lancasterfarming.com/node/4 About Lancaster Farming] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060821190018/http://lancasterfarming.com/node/4 |date=2006-08-21 }}</ref> In addition, many subscribers get farm newspapers for the advertising of specials on parts and supplies, used implements, and auctions of land, and equipment, and livestock.
''Lancaster Farming'' is printed in four to five sections, averaging about 200 pages per issue.<ref name=mk /> Section A is devoted to breaking news, dairy and beef news, commodity market reports, and upcoming events.<ref name=mk /> Section B is the family section which includes recipes, food and nutrition, antiques, and organizations such as 4-H, FFA and the [[The National Grange of the Order of Patrons of Husbandry|Grange]].<ref name=mk /> Sections C and D have business news, new product information and updates, and other agribusiness information. Numerous special sections published throughout the year cover topics such as the dairy industry, horses and renewable energy.<ref name=mk /> Section E is devoted to special segments of agriculture with such titles as Mid-Atlantic Horse, Eastern Dairy Reporter, Ag Technology, etc.<ref name=mk />
== Archive == ''Lancaster Farming'' 1955–2003 is available online through The Pennsylvania State University Libraries' [http://digitalnewspapers.libraries.psu.edu/Default/welcome.asp?skin=lancasterfarming&QS=skin%3Dlancasterfarming Digital Newspapers Program]. The Pennsylvania State University Libraries are also spearheading a collaborative effort in Pennsylvania to develop the [http://panewsarchive.psu.edu/ Pennsylvania Newspaper Archive (PANA)]. [http://panewsarchive.psu.edu/lccn/sn78001178/ Lancaster Farming, as a significant historical Pennsylvania newspaper], is included from initial publication in November 1955 until December 2003.
== References == <references/>
==External links== *{{official website|http://www.lancasterfarming.com}} *[http://idnc.library.illinois.edu/cgi-bin/illinois?a=cl&cl=CL1&sp=PLF Illinois Digital Newspaper Collections: ''Lancaster Farming'' (1955-1983)]
{{Steinman}}

revision.text:
{{tone|date=May 2013}} {{Translation sidebar}} The '''language industry''' is the sector of activity dedicated to facilitating multilingual communication, both oral and written. According to the European Commission's Directorate-General of Translation, the language industry comprises the activities of translation, interpreting, subtitling and dubbing, software and website globalisation, language technology tools development, international conference organisation, language teaching and linguistic consultancy.<ref>{{cite web|title=Language industry web platform|url=http://ec.europa.eu/dgs/translation/programmes/languageindustry/platform/index_en.htm|publisher=EC DG Translation|accessdate=3 April 2013}}</ref> According to the Canadian Language Industry Association, this sector comprises translation (with interpreting, subtitling and localisation), language training and language technologies.<ref>{{cite web|title=Our industry|url=http://www.ailia.ca/Our+Industry|publisher=Language Industry Association|accessdate=3 April 2013}}</ref> The European Language Industry Association limits the sector to translation, localisation, internationalisation and globalisation.<ref>{{cite web|title=ELIA membership application|url=http://www.elia-association.org/index.php?id=101&no_cache=1|publisher=European Language Industry Association|accessdate=3 April 2013}}</ref> An older, perhaps outdated view confines the language industry to computerised [[language processing]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.btb.gc.ca/btb.php?lang=eng&cont=700#l|title=Glossary - Translation Bureau|publisher=[[Public Works and Government Services Canada]]|accessdate=2009-04-12}}</ref> and places it within the [[information technology industry]]. An emerging view expands this sector to include [[Editing#Editing_services|editing]] for authors who write in a second language—especially English—for international communication.<ref>{{cite book|title=Supporting research writing: roles and challenges in multilingual settings|year=2013|publisher=Chandos|location=Oxford|pages=257–268|last=Matarese|first=Valerie. Supporting research writing in non-anglophone Europe: reflections and recurring themes|editor=Matarese Valerie}}</ref>
== Services == The scope of services in the industry includes: *[[Translation]] *[[Editing]] for authors: [[author editing]] *[[Editing]] for publishers, e.g. [[copy editing]], [[proofreading]] (including [[Computer-assisted reviewing|CAR]]), [[developmental editing]] *[[Language interpretation]] *[[Language education]] *[[Computer-assisted translation]] tools development *[[Terminology extraction]] *[[Language localisation]] *[[Software localisation]] *[[Machine translation]]
The persons who facilitate multilingual communication by offering individualized services—translation, interpreting, editing or language teaching—are called [[language professional]]s.
== Evolution == Translation as an activity exists at least since mankind started developing [[trade]] millennia ago; so, if we include [[interpreting]], it is no exaggeration to say that the origins of language industry are older than those of [[written language]].
Modern language industry has developed rapidly following availability of the [[internet]]. Achievements of the industry include the ability to quickly translate long texts into many languages. This has created new challenges as compared with the traditional activity of translators, such as that of [[quality assurance]]. There are various [[Translation-quality standards|quality standards]] such as the [[International Organization for Standardization]]'s ISO 17100, [[EN 15038]] in Europe, the CAN CGSB 131.10 in Canada and ASTM F2575-06 in the USA.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bsi-global.com/en/Shop/Publication-Detail/?pid=000000000030122045/|title=BS EN 15038:2006 Translation services. Service requirements|publisher=[[BSI Group]]|accessdate=2009-04-12}}</ref>
A study commissioned by the EC's Directorate-General for Translation estimated the language industry in European member states to be worth 8.4 billion euro in 2008.<ref>{{cite book|title=The size of the language industry in the EU|year=2009|publisher=European Commission DG Translation|isbn=978-92-79-14181-2|url=http://bookshop.europa.eu/is-bin/INTERSHOP.enfinity/WFS/EU-Bookshop-Site/en_GB/-/EUR/ViewPublication-Start?PublicationKey=HC8009985}}</ref> The largest portion, 5.7 billion euro, was ascribed to the activities of translation, interpreting, software localisation and website globalisation. Editing was not taken into consideration. The study projected an annual growth rate of 10% for the language industry. At the time the study was published, in 2009, the language industry was less affected by the economic crisis than other industry sectors.
One field of research in the industry includes the possibility of [[machine translation]] fully replacing human translation.<ref>{{cite journal|journal=Proceedings of TMI|last=Paul |first=Michael |author2=Andrew Finch |author3=Eiichiro Sumita |title=Reducing human assessment of machine translation quality to binary classifiers|year=2007|pages=154–162|url=http://www.mt-archive.info/TMI-2007-Paul.pdf|accessdate=2009-04-12}}</ref>
==Controversies== Rates for translation services have become a big discussion topic nowadays{{when?|date=January 2014}},<ref> {{Cite web|url=http://www.proz.com/forum/money_matters/147026-why_are_rates_so_low-page3.html|title=Why are rates so low?|publisher=[[ProZ.com]]|accessdate=2011-02-14}} </ref> as several translation outsourcers allegedly go in search of cheap labor. Professional associations like [[IAPTI]] try to put a stop to this development.<ref> [http://www.translatorscafe.com/cafe/MegaBBS/forumthread14854.htm A new T&I association is born] </ref> Currency fluctuation is yet another important factor.<ref> [http://www.globalwatchtower.com/2007/11/14/translation-pricing/ Rates for translation services to go up?]</ref>
Apart from this, phenomena such as [[crowdsourcing]] appear in large-scale translations.<ref> [http://www.globalwatchtower.com/2008/03/27/collaborative-translation-and-crowdsourcing/ Collaborative translation and crowdsourcing (in English and Portuguese)] </ref>
US President [[Barack Obama]] drew criticism after a 2009 White House white paper proposed incentives for automatic translation.<ref> [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2009-10-01/white-house-challenges-translation-industry-to-innovate White House Challenges Translation Industry to Innovate] </ref><ref> [https://www.atanet.org/pressroom/whitehouse_letter_oct2_2009.pdf Letter from ATA to President Obama] </ref>
== References == {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== *[http://www.mt-archive.info/LIM-TOC.htm Articles in Language Industry Monitor] (1991-1995) *[http://www.ailia.ca/National+Standard+for+Translation+Services CAN CGSB 131.10]
{{Industries}}
[[Category:Translation]] [[Category:Service industries]]

{{refimprove|date=June 2016}} '''Lightning Lab''' is a [[startup accelerator]] in [[New Zealand]], which has been operating since 2013. Lightning Lab is owned and managed by [[Creative HQ]], a startup incubator in Wellington.<ref name="CHQ-LLAB" /> Lightning Lab programmes have been delivered in [[Wellington]], [[Auckland]] and [[Christchurch]]. Lightning Lab operates various different programmes that each have a separate focus. Lightning Lab Digital is the accelerator catered towards software companies and has been run in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. Lightning Lab Manufacturing caters towards hardware startups, and there has been a single programme, run in [[Lower Hutt]], Wellington.<ref name="LLAB-MFG" /> Additionally, in 2016 Lightning Lab XX was held in Wellington with a focus on women-led companies with at least one woman on the founding team.<ref name="LLAB" />
Lightning Lab is sponsored nationally by Spark, [[Microsoft]], and [[Callaghan Innovation]], and programmes have been delivered by Creative HQ in Wellington, [[ICEHOUSE (incubator)|ICEHOUSE]] in Auckland, and CDC in Christchurch.<ref name="LLAB" />
Lightning Lab is a part of the Global Accelerator Network (GAN).<ref name="LLAB" />
To date, Lightning Lab has guided 150 entrepreneurs (63 startups) through rigorous learning, mentoring and business development that has resulted in over $10 million in private investment following the programme’s Demo Day investment events.<ref name="LLAB"/>
==References==
{{reflist|refs= <ref name=CHQ-LLAB>{{cite web|url=http://creativehq.co.nz/acceleration/lightning-lab/|title=LIGHTNING LAB - Creative HQ|publisher=creativehq.co.nz|accessdate=26 September 2016}}</ref> <ref name=LLAB>{{cite web|url=http://www.lightninglab.co.nz/programme-history/|title=PROGRAMME HISTORY - Lightning Lab|publisher=lightninglab.co.nz|accessdate=24 June 2016}}</ref> <ref name=LLAB-MFG>{{cite web|url=http://www.lightninglab.co.nz/manufacturing-wellington/|title=MFG Wellington 2015 - Lightning Lab|publisher=lightninglab.co.nz|accessdate=26 September 2016}}</ref> <!-- <ref name=stuff>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/business/small-business/77210012/foodcourt-online-app-startup-joins-lightning-lab-auckland-programme|title=Foodcourt Online app joins Lightning Lab|publisher=[[Stuff.co.nz]]|accessdate=24 June 2016}}</ref> <ref name=dex>http://dexibit.com/dx/</ref> <ref name=fc>http://www.foodcourtonline.co.nz/</ref> <ref name=kit>http://www.rock.ai/</ref> <ref name=pa>http://www.phoenixaudio.co.nz/</ref> <ref name=ry>http://www.reyedr.com/</ref> <ref name=ss>http://www.seekstock.co.nz/</ref> <ref name=sl>http://animelon.com/</ref> <ref name=si>http://f6s.com/sonnar</ref> <ref name=ww>https://waywiser.co.nz/</ref> <ref name=wg>https://wirelessguard.co.nz/</ref> --> }}
