{{peacock|date=January 2018}} {{tone|date=January 2018}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2016}}
{{Infobox Officeholder | name = Lordina Dramani Mahama | image = Lordina Dramani Mahama (cropped).jpg | office = [[First Lady of Ghana]] | term_label = In role | term_start = 24 July 2012 | term_end = 7 January 2017 | predecessor = [[Ernestina Naadu Mills]] | successor = [[Rebecca Akufo-Addo]] | president = [[John Dramani Mahama]]
| office2 = [[Second Lady]] of Ghana | term_label2 = In role | term_start2 = 7 January 2009 | term_end2 = 24 July 2012 | predecessor2 = Ramatu Aliu Mahama | successor2 = [[Matilda Amissah-Arthur]] | birth_name = Lordina Effah | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df = yes|1963|3|6}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = [[John Dramani Mahama]] | party = [[National Democratic Congress (Ghana)|National Democratic Congress]] | residence = [[Golden Jubilee House|Flagstaff House]] | alma_mater = [[Ghana Institute of Management and Public Administration]] }}
'''Lordina Mahama''' (born March 6, 1963) is a Ghanaian politician. She is married to the [[President of Ghana|fourth]] President of the Fourth Republic and current out-gone President of [[Ghana]], [[John Dramani Mahama]].<ref name=":0">{{cite web | url=http://www.graphic.com.gh/news/general-news/lordina-mahama-to-receive-honorary-doctorate.html | title=Lordina Mahama to receive honorary doctorate | publisher=graphic.com.gh | date=7 May 2015 | accessdate=22 July 2016}}</ref>
Prior to becoming First Lady, Lordina Mahama's husband served as a member of the [[Parliament of Ghana]] representing the Bole/Bamboi constituency during the 2000s.<ref name=gw>{{cite news|first=|last=|title=He "was a bit wild" - John Mahama's wife |url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/He-was-a-bit-wild-John-Mahama-s-wife-142278 |work=GhanaWeb |date=2008-04-15 |accessdate=2016-09-13}}</ref>
== Early life == She was born Lordina Effah on March 6, 1963 by the late Mr. and Mrs. Effah. Lordina is from Jema-Ampoma in the [[Nkoranza District]], located in the [[Brong-Ahafo Region]] of Ghana. She is last of three kids.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://edition.myjoyonline.com/pages/news/201212/98716.php|title=Lordina Mahama, Samira Bawumia graduate with higher degrees|last=Boateng|first=Michael Ofori Amanfo|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=https://www.newsghana.com.gh/up-close-with-lordina-mahama-first-lady-of-the-republic-of-ghana/|title=Up-Close With Lordina Mahama: First Lady Of The Republic Of Ghana|last=Ghana|first=News|date=2012-12-17|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref> She had her initial training in Tamale, Ghana at the Tishigu Anglican elementary school. She then proceeded to the Ghana Secondary School in Tamale, where she finished her GCE education.It was at Ghana Secondary School that Lordina met her future husband, John Dramani Mahama.<ref name=":1" />
==Education and career== Lordina was a student at Flair Catering Services,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Ensure-quality-service-in-hospitality-industry-Lordina-278995?channel=D1|title=Ensure quality service in hospitality industry - Lordina|website=www.ghanaweb.com|language=en|access-date=2017-10-03}}</ref> and received a four-year college education in Hospitality Management at the [[Ghana Institute of Management and Public Administration]] (GIMPA)<ref name=":0" /> She studied for a MA in Governance and Leadership at the [[Ghana Institute of Management and Public Administration]] (GIMPA).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://edition.myjoyonline.com/pages/news/201212/98716.php|title=Lordina Mahama, Samira Bawumia graduate with higher degrees|last=Boateng|first=Michael Ofori Amanfo|access-date=2016-08-29}}</ref>
== Political Appointments == === As Second Lady === She became second lady when her husband the former President of the Republic of Ghana [[John Dramani Mahama]] became the Vice-President of Ghana to President [[John Evans Atta-Mills]] on 7 January 2009.
=== As First lady === In line with [[Constitution of Ghana|Ghana's constitution]], her husband became [[President of Ghana]] on 24 July 2012 on the death of his predecessor, [[John Atta Mills]] and was sworn in Parliament in July, 2012, automatically making her the First Lady of the Republic of Ghana. In her tenure as First Lady, Lordina Mahama was also elected President of the Organisation of African First Ladies Against HIV and AIDS (OAFLA) in June 2015. Before that, she had served as the Vice President for the West Africa Region of OAFLA.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/The-1st-2nd-Lady-s-of-Ghana-323200|title=The 1st & 2nd Lady’s of Ghana ...|website=www.ghanaweb.com|language=en|access-date=2017-10-03}}</ref>
== Others == She speaks English, Hausa, Dagbani and Twi fluently.<ref name=":1" />
== Awards == The First Lady has a number of awards to her name and credit. These include: * Honorary Doctor of Humane Letters, by the President and Trustees of the [[Fordham University]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://citifmonline.com/2015/05/18/first-lady-honoured-with-a-doctorate-degree/|title=First Lady honoured with a doctorate degree|last=Allotey|first=Godwin Akweiteh|date=2015-05-18|website=citifmonline|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ghanaembassy.org/index.php?mact=News,cntnt01,print,0&cntnt01articleid=1288&cntnt01showtemplate=false&cntnt01returnid=99|title=Lordina Mahama Honoured With Doctorate Degree|website=www.ghanaembassy.org|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref> * An award for campaign for cervical cancer, Maputo, Mozambique.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://firstladygh.org/lordinamahama/about-first-lady/|title=About the First Lady {{!}} First Lady Ghana|website=firstladygh.org|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref> * Award for cervical cancer advocacy, Windhoek, Namibia<ref name=":4" /> * Inducted into the Global Women Leaders Hall of Fame<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ghanaiantimes.com.gh/first-lady-to-address-fordham-university/|title=First Lady to address Fordham University - The Ghanaian Times|website=www.ghanaiantimes.com.gh|language=en|access-date=2017-10-03}}</ref> * Global Inspiration Leadership Award at the Africa-Middle East-Asia summit in Dubai.<ref name=":4" /> * Enstooled as Sompahemaa of the Nkoranza Traditional Area, with a stool title (Nana Akosua Fremaa Ampomah Sika I )<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://ghanaradio.co/breaking-news/first-lady-lordina-enstooled-sompahemaa-of-nkoranza-traditional-council.html|title=First Lady Lordina Enstooled Sompahemaa Of Nkoranza Traditional Council|last=Administrator|access-date=2016-08-29}}</ref> * Enstooled as Development Queen in Bodom in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://www.newsghana.com.gh/first-lady-lordina-mahama-enstooled-as-development-queen-at-bodom-and-ampoma/|title=First Lady Lordina Mahama Enstooled As Development Queen At Bodom And Ampoma|date=2012-10-26|work=News Ghana|access-date=2017-10-03|language=en-US}}</ref> * Enstooled as Development Queen in Ampoma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana<ref name=":3" /> * Enstooled Development Queen in Anloga in Kumasi, Ashanti region of Ghana.{{cn|date=August 2018}}
== See also == * [[Nana Konadu Agyeman Rawlings]] * [[Theresa Kufuor]] * [[Ernestina Naadu Mills]]
== References == <references />

'''Melvin C. Steen''' (1907–1992) was an American attorney and founding partner of the New York law firm [[Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton]].<ref>{{cite web|author=WOLFGANG SAXONPublished: June 30, 1992 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/06/30/nyregion/melvin-c-steen-85-a-founder-of-the-cleary-gottlieb-law-firm.html |title=Melvin C. Steen, 85, a Founder Of the Cleary, Gottlieb Law Firm - New York Times |publisher=Nytimes.com |date=1992-06-30 |accessdate=2012-06-07}}</ref> Steen graduated from the [[University of Minnesota Law School]], where the Melvin C. Steen Professorship, currently held by [[Gregory Shaffer]], is named in his honor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.law.umn.edu/facultyprofiles/shafferg.html |title=Gregory Shaffer - U of MN Law School |publisher=Law.umn.edu |date= |accessdate=2012-06-07}}</ref> His survivors included his son Gordon of [[Owings Mills, Maryland]].<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/1992-07-01/news/1992183157_1_steen-gordon-r-bronxville |title=Melvin C. Steen, 85, a corporate and securities lawyer in... - Baltimore Sun |publisher=Articles.baltimoresun.com |date=1992-07-01 |accessdate=2012-06-07}}</ref>
Over the years, Steen's law partnerships have included [[Henry Friendly]] and [[George W. Ball]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/Cleary-Gottlieb-Steen-amp;-Hamilton-Company-History.html |title=Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton - Company History |publisher=Fundinguniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-06-07}}</ref>

{{Infobox officeholder | name = Mafijaska pudla | native_name = Небојша Човић | native_name_lang = sr | image = Nebojša Čović Cropped.jpg | image_size = | caption = {{small|Čović at an [[Social Democratic Party (Serbia 2001–2010)|SDP]] press conference in June 2006.}} | order = [[Government of Serbia (2001–2004)|Deputy Prime Minister of Serbia]] | primeminister = [[Zoran Đinđić]]
[[Zoran Živković (politician)|Zoran Živković]] | term_start = 25 January 2001 | term_end = 3 March 2004 | predecessor = [[Spasoje Krunić]] | successor = [[Miroljub Labus]] | order1 = [[Government of Serbia (2001–2004)|Prime Minister of Serbia]]
Acting | term_start1 = 12 March 2003 | term_end1 = 16 March 2003 | order2 = 66th [[Mayor of Belgrade]] | term_start2 = 23 June 1994 | term_end2 = 21 February 1997 | predecessor2 = [[Slobodanka Gruden]] | successor2 = [[Zoran Đinđić]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1958|7|2|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Belgrade]], [[People's Republic of Serbia|PR Serbia]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|FPR Yugoslavia]] | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = | alma_mater = [[University of Belgrade]] | nationality = Serbian | occupation = Politician, businessman | profession = Mechanical engineer | party = [[Socialist Party of Serbia]] {{small|(1990–1997)}}
[[Democratic Alternative (Serbia)|Democratic Alternative]] {{small|(1997–2004)}}
[[Social Democratic Party (Serbia 2001-2010)|Social Democratic Party]] {{small|(2004–2010)}} }} '''Nebojša Čović''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Небојша Човић}}; born 2 July 1958) is a Serbian businessman and basketball executive and former politician. He currently serves as a president for the [[KK Crvena zvezda|Crvena zvezda]]. ==Early years and education== Čović was born in [[Belgrade]], [[People's Republic of Serbia|PR Serbia]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|FPR Yugoslavia]], and graduated from the [[University of Belgrade]]'s Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. In 2000, he obtained his [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D]] at the same university. ==Political career== In 1992, as a member of the [[Socialist Party of Serbia]] (SPS), 34-year-old Čović started his climb up the political ladder with a position of executive board vice-president in charge of economy and finances at the Belgrade city assembly. A year later, in 1993, he advanced to the position of the city government president. In 1994 he got elected as the [[Mayor of Belgrade]]. In parallel, Čović was the SPS [[deputy (legislator)|deputy]] ([[Member of Parliament|MP]]) in the [[National Assembly of Serbia|Serbian National Assembly]]. Čović was sacked from the mayoral post in mid January 1997 by the Serbian president and SPS party leader [[Slobodan Milošević]] amid the [[1996–1997 protests in Serbia|months-long protests]] in Serbia over the November 1996 municipal elections fraud.[http://articles.cnn.com/1997-01-14/world/9701_14_yugo.update_1_zajedno-vuk-draskovic-serbian-president-slobodan-milosevic?_s=PM:WORLD Milosevic sacks mayors of Belgrade and Nis], cnn.com, 14 January 1997. He was expelled from SPS on the same occasion. He became the president of [[Democratic Alternative (Serbia)|Democratic Alternative]] (DA) after the party got formed by certain number of SPS members seceded from SPS in July 1997.[http://www.ex-yupress.com/danas/danas7.html Nebojsa Covic, president of the Democratic Alternative and former mayor of Belgrade: Ms. Mira Markovic Annulled November 1996 Elections, EX-YU Press, 21 November 1998] Čović served as the head of the Coordination Center for Kosovo and Metohija and as the head of the Southern Serbia Coordination Center during [[Insurgency in the Preševo Valley|Preševo Valley conflict]] (1999–2001).[http://www.b92.net/eng/news/old_archive-article.php?yyyy=2004&mm=02&dd=26&nav_category=12&nav_id=27154 Covic to stay at Kosovo Coordination Centre], B92.net, 26 February 2004. From 24 October 2000 to 25 January 2001 he was a member of the trio Co-Prime Ministers together with [[Milomir Minić]] from SPS and [[Spasoje Krunić]] from the [[Serbian Renewal Movement]] (SPO) that transitionally governed Serbia after the [[Bulldozer Revolution]], when [[Mirko Marjanović]] was sacked. After the [[assassination of Zoran Đinđić]], he was the acting Prime Minister of Serbia from 12 to 16 March 2003.[http://articles.cnn.com/2003-03-12/world/serbia.djindjic.shooting.1235_1_prime-minister-djindjic-natasa-micic-zoran-djindjic?_s=PM:WORLD Serbian PM shot dead], CNN.com, 12 March 2003. In 2004, his party Democratic Alternative merged into the [[Social Democratic Party (Serbia 2001–10)|Social Democratic Party]] (SDP). In 2005, he became president of the Social Democratic Party. The party ceased to exist in 2010.[http://www.vesti.rs/Vesti/Nebojsa-Covic-za-Press-POVRATAK-U-POLITIKU.html Povratak u politiku (in Serbian)][http://www.politika.rs/rubrike/Politika/Politichka-scena-bez-Liberala-Srbije-SDP-a-SLS-a.sr.html Politička scena bez Liberala Srbije, SDP-a i SLS-a]; accessed 17 April 2015. {{sr icon}} He has been charged for corruption in January 2016.http://www.blic.rs/vesti/hronika/optuznica-protiv-nebojse-covica-dostavljena-specijalnom-sudu/ljjjk93 ==Sports administration career== ;FMP Železnik (1991–2011) {{BLP unsourced section|date=April 2015}} In 1991 Čović became involved with Serbian basketball club KK ILR Železnik, a dormant sports collective for the workers of state-owned Ivo Lola Ribar metallurgical factory. Inactive since 1986, the club got revived by Čović under the auspices of his privately-owned metal products factory Fabrika metalnih proizvoda AD and renamed [[FMP Železnik]]. Under his guidance and ownership, the club grew into one of the top teams in Serbia and [[FR Yugoslavia]], developing a reputation for player development and quality work with younger categories. By 1993, the club got its own basketball facility — the 2,000-seat [[Železnik Hall]] that served as its home arena form then on. Climbing rapidly up the basketball pyramid in FR Yugoslavia, FMP began the 1994-95 season in the Second Federal League, winning promotion to the country's [[YUBA League|top basketball competition]] for the following 1995-96 season. In 1998, Čović brought former Yugoslav national team player [[Ratko Radovanović]] on board as the club's sporting director. Radovanović soon became synonymous with the emerging club, making player personnel decisions and running its day-to-day operations. Čović's son [[Filip Čović|Filip]] later played as [[point guard]] for the club. ;Yugoslav Basketball Federation (1995–1997) {{BLP unsourced section|date=April 2015}} In late 1995, while simultaneously performing the city of Belgrade mayoral job as well as Serbian National Assembly MP duties, Čović became president of the [[Basketball Federation of Serbia and Montenegro|Yugoslav Basketball Federation]] (KSJ), succeeding Veselin "Vesko" Barović in the job. In addition to Čović's political connections through SPS, the rapid success of his club FMP Železnik that was about to start competing in the country's top league that season after multiple promotions was the best possible recommendation for the job. At the time when Čović came on board to lead the federation, FR Yugoslavia national team led by [[Dušan Ivković|Duda Ivković]] were the reigning [[EuroBasket 1995|European champions]], having returned to international competition following a four-year exile due to the UN embargo. Ivković soon stepped down and his assistant [[Željko Obradović]] took over the national team head coaching job. The national team had a great run at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, reaching the final against the American Dream Team composed of NBA players. In early 1997, soon after Čović's fall from grace in SPS, he was removed from the KSJ job as well. ==See also== * [[Mayor of Belgrade]] ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == {{commons category|Nebojša Čović}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{Succession box | before = [[Slobodanka Gruden]] | title = [[Mayor of Belgrade]] | years = 1994 – 1997 | after = [[Zoran Đinđić]] }} {{s-sports}} {{Succession box | before = [[Vladislav Lučić]] | title = President of the [[KK Crvena zvezda]] | years = 2011 – present | after = Incumbent }} {{Succession box | before = [[Mladen Veber]] | title = President of the [[ABA League JTD]] | years = 2017 – present | after = Incumbent }} {{Succession box | before = [[Veselin Barović]] | title = President of the [[Basketball Federation of Serbia and Montenegro|Basketball Federation of Yugoslavia]] | years = 1995 – 1997 | after = [[Dragoslav Ražnatović]] }} {{end}} {{KK Crvena zvezda}} {{Adriatic League}} {{BGMayor}} {{Cabinet of Serbia (2001–04)}} {{SerbianPM}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Covic, Nebojsa}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Belgrade]] [[Category:Socialist Party of Serbia politicians]] [[Category:Democratic Alternative (Serbia) politicians]] [[Category:Social Democratic Party (Serbia 2001–10) politicians]] [[Category:KK Crvena Zvezda executives]] [[Category:Mayors of Belgrade]] [[Category:Serbian businesspeople]] [[Category:Serbian basketball executives and administrators]] [[Category:University of Belgrade Faculty of Mechanical Engineering alumni]]

revision.text:
'''Presidential Ambassadors for Global Entrepreneurship'''<ref>{{cite web |last1=Tau |first1=Byron |title=Meet President Obama's Entrepreneurship Ambassadors - U.S |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2015/05/11/meet-president-obamas-entrepreneurship-ambassadors/ |website=Wall Street Journal |publisher=Wall Street Journal |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref> or PAGE is a collaborative initiative that was created by former United States President [[Barack Obama]] tasked with entrepreneurial growth.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Pritzker |first1=Penny |title=Announcing President Obama's New Ambassadors for Global Entrepreneurship |url=https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/blog/2014/04/10/announcing-president-obama-s-new-ambassadors-global-entrepreneurship |website=White House |publisher=White House.Gov |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref>.
PAGE was founded by then United States President Barack Obama in 2014. The prime focus of the group is to increase the business startup culture in the United States.
In 2016, [[Theranos]] CEO [[Elizabeth Holmes]] stepped down as one of the ambassador's of the program due to a federal investigation into some of her activities.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Reo |first1=Leann |title=Embattled Theranos CEO Steps Down As Obama Business Ambassador |url=http://fortune.com/2016/08/02/federal-government-theranos/ |website=Fortune |publisher=Fortune |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref>. Holmes had joined PAGE in 2015.<ref>{{cite web |last1=della Cava |first1=Marco |title=Airbnb's Chesky, Theranos' Holmes among presidential entrepreneurs |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2015/05/11/airbnbs-chesky-theranos-holmes-among-presidential-entrepreneurs/27142157/ |website=USA Today |publisher=USA Today |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref>
Other noted ambassadors for PAGE include former [[AOL]] CEO [[Steve Case]],<ref>{{cite web |last1=Bosilkovski |first1=Igor |title=Techies Upset Over Trump Administration Killing A Rule That Would Have Helped Foreign Entrepreneurs |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/igorbosilkovski/2017/07/10/techies-upset-over-trump-administration-killing-a-rule-that-would-have-helped-foreign-entrepreneurs/ |website=Forbes |publisher=Forbes |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref> [[Shark Tank]] investor [[Daymond John]], who was appointed to his post in 2015,<ref>{{cite web |last1=Johnson |first1=Ted |title=Shark Tank' at the White House: Daymond John Named Entrepreneurship Ambassador |url=https://variety.com/2015/tv/news/shark-tank-white-house-daymond-john-named-entrepreneurship-ambassador-1201492470/ |website=Variety |publisher=Variety |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref> [[Mozilla]] board member [[Julie Hanna]] and [[Helen Greiner]] (CTO of CyPhworks). Both Hanna and Greiner were two of the five women who were named ambasaddors of PAGE at the time.<ref>{{cite web |title=5 Women Named As American Ambassadors for Entrepreneurship |url=https://herahub.com/resources/5-women-named-american-ambassadors-entrepreneurship/ |website=Hera Hub |publisher=Hera Hub |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref>
In 2018, Inaugural PAGE member<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.commerce.gov/file/page-ambassador-nina-vaca-pinnacle-technical-resources |title=PAGE Ambassador – Nina Vaca of Pinnacle Technical Resources |website=Department of Commerce |language=en |access-date=2018-11-03}}</ref> and Chairman and CEO of Pinnacle Group, [[Nina Vaca]] had a day named after her in [[Houston, Texas]] due to her efforts in improving the hispanic and immigration community in [[Texas]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner proclaims March 8 Nina Vaca Day at 11th Annual Tribute to the Hispanic Woman |url=https://www.prweb.com/releases/2018/03/prweb15298233.htm |website=PR Web |publisher=PR Web |accessdate=5 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dallasnews.com/business/technology/2017/08/25/immigrant-family-tech-ceo-nina-vaca-uses-success-spread-global-entrepreneurship|title=From immigrant family to tech CEO, Nina Vaca uses her success to spread global entrepreneurship|date=25 August 2017|publisher=}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links== * [https://www.commerce.gov/PAGE About the Presidential Ambassadors for Global Entrepreneurship]. US Department of Commerce.
[[Category:Entrepreneurship organizations]] [[Category:Presidency of Barack Obama]]

{{Use Australian English|date=October 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Infobox organisation | name = Public Relations Institute of Australia | image = Public_Relations_Institute_of_Australia_logo.gif | established = 1949 | type = Professional association | headquarters = Sydney, Australia | region_served = Australia | website = {{URL|http://www.pria.com.au}} }} The '''Public Relations Institute of Australia''' (PRIA) is a [[peak organisation|peak body]] for [[public relations]] and communication professionals in Australia. It promotes high ethical standards in the public relations and communication industry through accredited membership, resources, training, and recognition.
PRIA was founded in 1949. It sponsors the [[open access]] ''[[Asia Pacific Public Relations Journal]]''. The organisation is a member of the Global Alliance for Public Relations and Communication Management.
== Projects == In 2014, PRIA projects included advising on lobbyist legislation, increasing the use of valid measurement in PR, and offering career development and professional support resources to practitioners.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bandt.com.au/media/ray-shaw-lead-pria-new-ceo |archivedate=25 October 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141025125023/http://www.bandt.com.au/media/ray-shaw-lead-pria-new-ceo |date=20 June 2014 |title=Ray Shaw to lead PRIA as new CEO |publisher=B&T |first=Neil |last=O'Sullivan |}}</ref> PRIA also offers member training and professional development, runs a consultancy registration scheme, organises conferences and networking events, and presents annual awards for outstanding programs (the Golden Target Awards).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://noelturnbull.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/06/How-PR-works-but-often-doesnt.pdf |first=Noel |last=Turnbull |page=27 |title=How PR works... but often doesn't |date=2010 |publisher=N.S. & J.S. Turnbull |isbn=978-0-646-53625-5 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141026093008/http://noelturnbull.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/06/How-PR-works-but-often-doesnt.pdf |archivedate=26 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.amazon.com/Global-Public-Relations-Spanning-Cultures/dp/0415448158 |title=Global Public Relations: Spanning Borders, Spanning Cultures |first1=Alan R. |last1=Freitag |first2=Ahsli |last2=Quesinberry Stokes |page=100 |publisher=Routledge |date=2009 |isbn=0-203-89018-3}}</ref>
=== Course accreditations === PRIA introduced accreditation of Australian public relations courses in the late 1980s and 1990s.<ref>{{cite journal |journal=[[PRism (journal) |PRism]] |url=http://www.prismjournal.org/fileadmin/10_1/Johnston_Macnamara.pdf |title=Public relations literature and scholarship in Australia: A brief history of change and diversification |date=2013 |volume=10 |issue=1 |page=9 |first1=Jane |last1=Johnston |first2=Jim |last2=Macnamara}}</ref> It identifies three core benefits to accreditation:<ref>{{cite web |publisher=PRIA |author= |title=PRIA Accreditation for Educational Programs |date=2014 |url=http://www.pria.com.au/eventsawards/accreditation-for-educational-programs |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140923185850/https://www.pria.com.au/eventsawards/accreditation-for-educational-programs |archivedate=23 September 2014}}</ref> * committing education providers to aligning with current industry practice * uniting educators and industry to progress the PR profession * equipping graduates with best practice skills and competencies PRIA continues to accredit courses for a five-year rolling period, but the Australian Government has not [[charter]]ed the association and PRIA does not demand degrees from its members.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/higher-education/the-profession-that-dare-not-speak-its-name/story-e6frgcjx-1225891321598?nk=969b9f190510ddb15a4e647b2c989844 |newspaper=[[The Australian]] |title=The profession that dare not speak its name |first=Stephen |last=Matchett |date=14 July 2010}}</ref>
==Partnerships and sponsorships== When [[Deakin University]] began publishing the ''Asia Pacific Public Relations Journal'' in 1999, PRIA became a sponsor of the publication, and it continues its support today.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://ojs.deakin.edu.au/index.php/apprj/about/journalSponsorship |title=Journal Sponsorship |publisher=Deakin University |accessdate=2014-11-03}}</ref>
PRIA is one of 25 founding members of the Global Alliance for Public Relations and Communication Management.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.globalalliancepr.org/website/member/public-relations-institute-australia-pria |title=Members: Public Relations Institute of Australia (PRIA) |publisher=Global Alliance for Public Relations and Communication Management |accessdate=2014-11-03}}</ref>
In September 2014, PRIA announced a partnership with the International Special Events Society to enable PRIA members to earn professional development points by attending ISES events.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.spicenews.com.au/2014/09/pria-ises-partnership-explained/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141103081420/http://www.spicenews.com.au/2014/09/pria-ises-partnership-explained/|archivedate=3 November 2014 |title=PRIA and ISES partnership explained |first=Emma |last=Gardiner |date=4 September 2014 |publisher=Spice News |accessdate=2014-11-03}}</ref>
== History == When PRIA was established in 1949, [[Asher Joel]] was one of its founding members.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pria.com.au/aboutus/in-honour/sir-asher-joel |archivedate=25 October 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141025130519/http://www.pria.com.au/aboutus/in-honour/sir-asher-joel |title=Sir Asher Joel |deadurl=no |publisher=PRIA}}</ref>
PRIA established the annual Golden Target Awards in 1976, to recognise excellence in Australian public relations.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://publications.crowtherblayne.com.au/pria-golden-target-awards/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140303035927/http://publications.crowtherblayne.com.au/pria-golden-target-awards/ |archivedate=3 March 2014 |title=PRIA Golden Target Awards| publisher=Crowther Blayne & Associates 2014}}</ref> The [[University of Western Sydney]]'s Ward Library is home to the winners collection which dates from 1998.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pria.com.au/eventsawards/cid/14/t/eventsawards/l/layout |author=PRIA |publisher=PRIA |title=Golden Target Award (GTA) past winners |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141029095011/http://www.pria.com.au/eventsawards/cid/14/t/eventsawards/l/layout |archivedate=29 October 2014}}</ref>
When the Public Relations Council was formed in 2012, PR practitioners discussed whether Australia's PR industry was big enough for two peak bodies, generally concluding that the market could embrace both organisations.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marketingmag.com.au/interviews/debate-is-australian-pr-big-enough-for-two-industry-bodies-26196/#.VE879K0cQy8 |publisher=Marketing Mag |date=6 November 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130705232300/http://www.marketingmag.com.au/interviews/debate-is-australian-pr-big-enough-for-two-industry-bodies-26196/#.VE879K0cQy8 |archivedate=5 July 2013 |title=Debate: Is Australian PR big enough for two industry bodies?}}</ref>
=== Presidents === The following persons have been presidents of PRIA: {{columns-list|colwidth=30em| * Sylvia Bell (2018-) * Jennifer Muir (2016–2018) * Mike Watson (2014–2016) * Terri-Helen Gaynor (2012–2013) * Nicholas Turner (2011–2012) * Robin Xavier (October 2009–2011) * Tracy Jones (2008–2009) * Annabelle Warren (2005–2007) * Rob Masters (2003–2005) * Liz McLaughlin (2001–2003) * Jim Macnamara (1999–2001) * Marjorie Anderson (1992–1993) * Bill Mackey (1988) * Hat Myers (1981–1982) }}
==References== {{Reflist}} {{Commons cat|Public relations}}

revision.text:
{{capitalism}} The term '''regulatory capitalism''' suggests that the operation maintenance and development of the [[International political economy|global political economy]] increasingly depends on administrative rules outside the legislatures and the courts.
The general trend despite and beyond the process of [[liberalization]] is that of growth rather than decline of [[regulation]]. [[Deregulation]] may represent trends in some industries (notably finance), but more regulation is the general trend beyond that characterize modern and post-modern capitalism alike.<ref>[[Levi-Faur, David]], ''The Global Diffusion of Regulatory Capitalism'', The ANNALS of the [[American Academy of Political and Social Science]], March 2005, vol. 598, no. 1, pp. 12–13.</ref> Regulation in this interpretation is an instrument of organizations—states, business, civil and hybrid and is carried at all political arenas and levels.
The concept of regulatory capitalism serves as an alternative to concepts like [[financial capitalism]], [[welfare capitalism]], [[Casino Capitalism|casino capitalism]], [[developmental capitalism]], [[risk capitalism]], [[state capitalism]] and [[crony capitalism]] in an attempt to shed more light on capitalism as a polymorphous order.
== See also == * [[Regulated market]] * [[Regulatory capture]] * [[Regulatory state]] * [[State capitalism]]
== References == {{reflist}}
== Bibliography == * David Levi-Faur and Jacint Jordana Eds, ''The Rise of Regulatory Capitalism: The Global Diffusion of a New Order'', The Annals of the American Academy of Political and Social Science Series.
[[Category:Capitalism]] [[Category:Sociology of law]] [[Category:Political science]] [[Category:Economic globalization]] [[Category:Public administration]] [[Category:Economics of regulation]]

{{BLP sources|date=June 2016}} {{use mdy dates|date=June 2013}} {{infobox ambassador |name = Ronald Lauder |image = Ronald S Lauder - Rally against anti-Semitism - Berlin 14 September 2014 - 1 - c MichaelThaidigsmann (cropped).jpg |caption = Ronald S. Lauder (September 2014) |birth_name = Ronald Steven Lauder |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1944|2|26|}} |birth_place = New York City, New York, United States |occupation = Chairman Emeritus of [[Estée Lauder Companies]] |nationality = United States |blank1 = Net worth |data1 = {{increase}} US$3.7 [[1,000,000,000 (number)|billion]] ''(September 2013)''[https://www.forbes.com/profile/ronald-lauder/ Forbes The World's Billionaires: Ronald Lauder] September 2013 |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] |spouse = Jo Carole Knopf |children = [[Jane Lauder|Jane Lauder Warsh]]
[[Aerin Lauder|Aerin Lauder Zinterhofer]] |parents = [[Estée Lauder (businesswoman)|Estée Lauder]]
Joseph Lauder | relatives = [[Leonard Lauder]]
(brother) |office = President of the [[World Jewish Congress]] |term_start = June 10, 2007 |predecessor = [[Edgar Bronfman, Sr.]] |office2 = [[United States Ambassador to Austria]] |president2 = [[Ronald Reagan]] |term_start2 = April 16, 1986 |term_end2 = October 27, 1987 |predecessor2 = [[Helene A. von Damm]] |successor2 = [[Henry Anatole Grunwald]] |alma_mater = The [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania]] ([[Bachelor of Science|BS]])}} '''Ronald Steven Lauder''' (born February 26, 1944) is an American businessman, art collector, and political activist. He is an heir to the [[Estée Lauder Companies]], and the president of the [[World Jewish Congress]]. ==Early life and education== Lauder was born in [[New York City]], the son of [[Estée Lauder (businesswoman)|Estée Lauder]] and Joseph Lauder, founders of [[Estée Lauder Companies]]. He is the younger brother of [[Leonard Lauder]], chairman of the board of the Estée Lauder Companies. The boys were raised [[Jewish]]. He attended the [[Bronx High School of Science]] and holds a bachelor's degree in International Business from the [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania]]. He studied at the [[University of Paris]], and received a Certificate in International Business from the [[University of Brussels]]. ==Career== Lauder started to work for the Estée Lauder Company in 1964. In 1984, he became a Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for European and NATO policy at the [[United States Department of Defense]]. In 1986, [[Ronald Reagan]] named him as the [[United States Ambassador to Austria]], a position he held until 1987. As ambassador, he fired diplomatic officer [[Felix Bloch (diplomatic officer)|Felix Bloch]], who later became known in connection with the [[Robert Hanssen]] espionage case.{{cite news|url= https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=950DE7DD1E3EF934A15754C0A96F948260|title= Just Who Was Our Envoy to Vienna?| work = [[The New York Times]] |date= July 27, 1989|accessdate= February 28, 2009}} As a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]], he made a bid to become the [[mayor of New York City]] in 1989, losing to [[Rudy Giuliani]] in the Republican primary. [[Michael Massing]], writing of this nomination race, notes that politically Lauder 'seemed out of step with most American Jews; ... he ran to the right of Rudolph Giuliani. And, on Israeli issues, he was a vocal supporter of the [[Likud]] party, with long-standing ties to [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]."[[Michael Massing|Massing, Michael]] (March 2001). "Deal Breakers". ''[[The American Prospect]]''. In 1998, Lauder was asked by [[Prime Minister of Israel|Israeli Prime Minister]] Benjamin Netanyahu to begin [[Diplomacy#Informal diplomacy|Track II negotiations]] with [[Syria]]n leader [[Hafez al-Assad]]; these negotiations continued after the election of [[Ehud Barak]] to the post. Lauder communicated a new-found willingness on Assad's part to make compromises with the Israelis in an overall [[land for peace]] deal, and his draft "Treaty of Peace Between Israel and Syria" formed an important part of the (ultimately fruitless) Israeli-Syrian negotiations that occurred in January 2000 in [[Shepherdstown, West Virginia|Shepherdstown]], [[West Virginia]].{{cite book |last = Indyk |first = Martin |authorlink = Martin Indyk |title = Innocent Abroad: An Intimate Account of American Peace Diplomacy in the Middle East |publisher = [[Simon & Schuster]] |year = 2009 |doi = |isbn = }} Lauder manages investments in real estate and media, including [[Central European Media Enterprises]] and Israeli TV. In 2010, Lauder founded RWL Water, LLC. ==Civic and philanthropic activities== Lauder is actively involved in numerous civic organizations, including the [[Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations]], the [[Jewish National Fund]], the [[World Jewish Congress]], the [[American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee]], the [[Anti-Defamation League]], the [[Jewish Theological Seminary of America|Jewish Theological Seminary]], [[Brandeis University]], and the [[Abraham Fund]]. With his brother he founded the Lauder Institute at Wharton School. Lauder has also served as a finance chairman of the [[New York Republican State Committee]]. In 2003, Lauder founded and became a president of [[Lauder Business School]] in [[Vienna]], [[Austria]]. Lauder led a movement to introduce [[term limit]]s in the [[New York City Council]], which were subsequently imposed on most NYC elected officials, including the Mayor and City Council, after a citywide referendum in 1993. In 1996, voters turned down a council proposal to extend term limits. Lauder spent $4 million on the two referendums. He has been involved in environmental conservation efforts in eastern Long Island and has served on the board of directors of the conservation organization Group for the East End since 2002.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} ===Art=== On November 16, 2001, Lauder opened the [[Neue Galerie New York|Neue Galerie]] in New York, an art museum across the street from the [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]]. The Neue Galerie is dedicated to art from Germany and Austria from the early 20th century. It holds one of the best collections of works by [[Egon Schiele]] in the world. On June 18, 2006, he purchased from [[Maria Altmann]] and her family, the painting ''[[Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer I]]'' by [[Gustav Klimt]] for $135 million, the [[List of most expensive paintings|highest price ever paid for a painting]] at that time. Lauder called the painting "Our [[Mona Lisa]]". He reportedly saw Klimt's portrait as a youth in Vienna and had admired it since.{{cite web |author= Vogel, Carol |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/06/19/arts/design/19klim.html |title= Lauder Pays $135 Million, a Record, for a Klimt Portrait |date= June 19, 2006 |work= [[The New York Times]] |access-date= June 23, 2016}}{{cite web |url= http://articles.latimes.com/2006/jun/19/local/me-klimt19 |title= Klimt Painting Sells for Record Amount |work= [[Los Angeles Times]]}} The painting, a [[Nazi plunder|Nazi-looted art piece]] which had just been restored to Altmann following years of negotiation and litigation with the [[Austrian government]], now forms the centerpiece of the museum's collection. Lauder also has the world's largest private collection of [[Components of medieval armour|medieval]] and [[Renaissance]] [[armor]].{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} Lauder has been instrumental in a number of cases in recovering "lost" art from the Nazi period.{{cite web |url=http://financialservices.house.gov/banking/21000lau.htm |title=Testimony of Ronald S. Lauder, Chairman, Commission for Art Recovery, World Jewish Congress, Before The House Committee on Banking and Financial Services, February 10, 2000 |accessdate=2006-06-20 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060602014451/http://financialservices.house.gov/banking/21000lau.htm |archivedate=June 2, 2006 |df=mdy-all }}. financialservices.house.gov He has been criticized for failure to resolve a case involving the [[Museum of Modern Art]] (MoMA), which in 1997 exhibited some paintings owned by [[Rudolph Leopold]], a Viennese doctor and art collector. An investigative article in ''The New York Times'' on December 24, 1997 – "A Singular Passion for Amassing Art, One Way or Another" – outlined a case involving ''[[Portrait of Wally]]'' by [[Egon Schiele]], which was in the MoMA exhibition but was obtained by Leopold soon after the Nazi era. The [[New York County District Attorney]] (Manhattan) stepped in to help restore the piece to descendants of its original owner, but ownership of the painting is still in contention, nearly ten years later. Lauder has been accused of a failure to act on the case, despite being MoMA chairman at the time.Dobrzynski, Judith H. (January 25, 1998) [https://www.nytimes.com/1998/01/29/arts/man-in-the-middle-of-the-schiele-case.html?pagewanted=all&src=pm "Man in the Middle of the Schiele Case"]. ''[[The New York Times]]''. Lauder is an honorary trustee of the [[World Monuments Fund]], a New York-based non-profit with the mission of protecting endangered cultural heritage sites around the world. ===Ronald S. Lauder Foundation=== {{BLP unsourced section|date=June 2016}} In 1987, Lauder established the Ronald S. Lauder Foundation, a philanthropic organization that is dedicated to rebuilding Jewish life in Central and Eastern [[Europe]].{{Cite web|url=https://lauderfoundation.com/president|title=Our President|website=lauderfoundation.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-09-27}} The foundation also supports student exchange programs between New York and various capitals in Central and Eastern Europe. ===Alzheimer's Research=== In 1998, Lauder co-founded the [[Alzheimer's Drug Discovery Foundation]] with his brother, [[Leonard Lauder|Leonard A. Lauder]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.elcompanies.com/~/media/Files/E/Estee-Lauder/media-resources-executive-profiles/Ronald%20S%20Lauder.pdf|title=Ronald S. Lauder Biography|last=The Estée Lauder Companies|first=|date=|website=The Estée Lauder Companies|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170622163608/http://www.elcompanies.com/~/media/Files/E/Estee-Lauder/media-resources-executive-profiles/Ronald%20S%20Lauder.pdf|archive-date=2017-06-22|dead-url=yes|access-date=September 26, 2017}} Its mission it to "rapidly accelerate the discovery of drugs to prevent, treat and cure Alzheimer's disease.{{Cite web|url=https://www.alzdiscovery.org/about-addf|title=About Us {{!}} Alzheimer's Drug Discovery Foundation|website=www.alzdiscovery.org|language=en|access-date=2017-09-27}}" Ronald continues as the Foundation's co-chairman. ===President of the World Jewish Congress=== [[File:Marx-Schneider-Lauder-Gauck-Graumann-Merkel.jpg|thumb|Lauder with German leaders at a rally against anti-Semitism in Berlin, September 14, 2014. Left to right: Cardinal [[Reinhard Marx]], Protestant Church leader [[Nikolaus Schneider]], Ronald S. Lauder, German Federal President [[Joachim Gauck]], Central Council of Jews in Germany President Dieter Graumann, German Federal Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]].]] Lauder was elected president of the [[World Jewish Congress]] on June 10, 2007,{{cite news |title=Lauder elected President of WJCongress |url=https://www.jpost.com/Jewish-World/Jewish-News/Lauder-elected-President-of-WJCongress |work=The Jerusalem Post |date=June 10, 2007}} following the resignation of [[Edgar Bronfman, Sr.]]. He beat the South African businessman [[Mendel Kaplan (philanthropist)|Mendel Kaplan]] and [[Einat Wilf]] of Israel by a clear margin. As head of the international Jewish umbrella organization, he has met with a number of heads of state and government, including German Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]], [[Pope Benedict XVI]], Italian President [[Giorgio Napolitano]], Austrian Chancellor [[Alfred Gusenbauer]], Czech President [[Václav Klaus]], Hungarian Prime Minister [[Ferenc Gyurcsány]], King [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia]], King [[Abdullah II of Jordan|Abdullah of Jordan]], Swiss President [[Pascal Couchepin]], Venezuelan President [[Hugo Chávez]] and Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto. President [[George W. Bush]] appointed him to serve on the honorary delegation to accompany him to [[Jerusalem]] for the celebration of the 60th anniversary of the [[State of Israel]] in May 2008.{{cite news | author = [[Eli Lake|Lake, Eli]] | url=http://www.nysun.com/foreign/bush-visit-may-boost-olmert/76303/ |title=Bush Visit May Boost Olmert |newspaper= [[The New York Sun]] |date=May 13, 2008 | access-date = June 23, 2016}} Lauder condemned the [[Rohingya persecution in Myanmar (2016–present)|persecution of Rohingya Muslims]] in [[Myanmar]]. He said in a statement that "The World Jewish Congress is extremely concerned by the plight of the Rohingya minority in Myanmar, who has suffered widespread persecution for years under the ruling military government and has been forced to flee in the hundreds of thousands in the past two weeks alone."{{cite web|url=http://www.worldjewishcongress.org/en/news/world-jewish-congress-condemns-myanmars-persecution-of-rohingya-urges-international-community-to-safeguard-rights-of-all-minorities-9-2-2017|author=World Jewish Congress|website=worldjewishcongress.org|title=World Jewish Congress condemns Myanmar’s persecution of Rohingya, urges international community to safeguard rights of all minorities :: World Jewish Congress |accessdate=2017-09-14}} ===Jewish activism=== In July 2009, [[Bernie Ecclestone]] faced calls from Lauder to resign as [[Formula One]] chief after he had praised [[Adolf Hitler]] in a newspaper interview and said that Hitler "got things done". Lauder said someone with Ecclestone's views should not be allowed to run such an important and popular racing series. He urged Formula One teams, drivers and host countries to suspend their cooperation with him. In reaction, Ecclestone told the news agency Associated Press that "I think the people who are saying that haven't got the power to say these things." Asked if the [[World Jewish Congress]] was influential, Ecclestone said: "It's a pity they didn't sort the banks out" and "They have a lot of influence everywhere". After a public outcry, Ecclestone apologized for his remarks and said he had "been an idiot".{{cite web|url=http://www.cbssports.com/nascar/story/11923197|title=F1 boss Ecclestone faces criticism over Hitler comments|publisher= [[CBS Sports]] |date=July 4, 2009|accessdate=July 2, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/sports/jews-call-on-bernie-ecclestone-to-resign-over-hitler-remarks_100214406.html|title=Jews call on Bernie Ecclestone to resign over Hitler remarks|work=ThaiIndian.com|date=July 6, 2009|accessdate=July 2, 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/rpm/racing/f1/news/story?id=4308574 |title=Ecclestone: Outrage 'probably my fault{{'-}}|agency=Associated Press|date=July 6, 2009|accessdate=July 2, 2012}} In December 2009, Lauder protested against the Roman Curia's decree recognizing the heroic virtues of [[Pope Pius XII]], asserting that an eventual [[beatification]] would be inopportune until the Holy See's historical archives from the 1939–1945 period were opened.[http://www.jpost.com/Jewish-World/World-Jewish-Congress-criticizes-Popes-decision-to-beatify-Pius-XII "World Jewish Congress criticizes Pope's decision to beatify Pius XII"]. ''[[The Jerusalem Post]]'' (December 21, 2009). In 2011, writing in the German newspaper ''[[Die Welt]]'',[https://www.welt.de/debatte/kommentare/article12470166/Warum-Israel-Mitglied-der-Nato-werden-muss.html "Ronald Lauder, Warum Israel Mitglied der Nato werden muss"]. ''Die Welt'', February 7, 2011. Lauder called for Israel to be admitted into the Western defense alliance [[NATO]]: "Israel needs real guarantees for its security. European NATO member states – including Turkey – must admit the state of Israel into the Western alliance," the WJC president wrote. He referred to the uprisings in Egypt and Tunisia and said they were reminders of how "unpredictable" developments in the Middle East were. Israeli NATO membership "would send a strong signal to other countries not to take on Israel", Lauder argued.[http://www.thejc.com/world-jewish-congress/44854/call-israel-join-nato "Call for Israel to join NATO"]. ''Jewish Chronicle''. February 8, 2011. [[File:Ronald Lauder WJC 2014.jpg|thumb|left|Lauder addressing a [[World Jewish Congress]] meeting in Berlin]] Lauder has also been outspoken on anti-Semitism. In an opinion article entitled "Sweden's Shame", he attacked the Swedish government, church officials and media for "fanning the flames" of hatred against Jews.Lauder, Ronald S. (August 12, 2010). [http://www.project-syndicate.org/commentary/sweden-s-shame "Sweden's Shame"]. Project Syndicate. In May 2012, Lauder condemned as "despicable" remarks made by the Norwegian sociologist [[Johan Galtung]] who had "revived anti-Semitic canards such as Jewish control of the media" and suggested that Israel's Mossad could have been behind the 2011 "massacres in Norway committed by Anders Breivik" in which 77 people died. Lauder declared: "There is a growing tendency to blame the Jews for all evil that happens under the sun. It is a scandal that a leading academics such as Galtung does not shy away from citing notorious forgeries such as the [[Protocols of the Elders of Zion]] to support his bigoted arguments."[http://www.eju.org/news/world/ronald-lauder-condemns-norwegian-scholar-anti-semitic-statements "Ronald Lauder condemns Norwegian scholar anti-Semitic statements"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120518075946/http://www.eju.org/news/world/ronald-lauder-condemns-norwegian-scholar-anti-semitic-statements |date=May 18, 2012 }}. ''EJU News''. May 3, 2012. In August 2012, Lauder criticized Austrian politicians for failing to publicly denounce the leader of the third-largest political party in the country, the FPÖ, Heinz-Christian Strache, who had posted an anti-Semitic cartoon on his [[Facebook]] page. "Clearly, and not for the first time, the FPÖ leader is trying to whip up anti-Semitic sentiment. His repeated denials are not credible because his words and actions speak for themselves," Ronald Lauder said in a statement, adding: "This scandal shows that anti-Jewish resentment is still widespread, and unscrupulous politicians are allowed to exploit it for electioneering purposes. That is mind-boggling, and it could have negative repercussions for Austrian Jews."Prodhan, Georgina (August 23, 2012) [https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/23/us-austria-rightists-antisemitism-idUSBRE87M0NL20120823 "Austrian rightist chief accused of anti-Semitism over cartoon"]. [[Reuters]]. Lauder has been strongly critical of business deals by European energy firms with Iran and called for stronger UN sanctions because of Tehran's threat against Israel and its nuclear program. In April 2008, he criticized a visit by Swiss Foreign Minister [[Micheline Calmy-Rey]] to Tehran where she met with Iran's President [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]] to help a Swiss company secure a multibillion-dollar contract to buy natural gas from Iran. Lauder told a press conference in Bern: "Maybe that money that Switzerland is paying to Iran will some day be used to either buy weapons to kill Israelis, or buy weapons to kill Americans, or buy missiles to be able to deliver nuclear weapons."[https://www.usatoday.com/news/world/2008-04-29-3972860867_x.htm%20 "World Jewish Congress head wants Swiss to cancel Iran deal"] Associated Press. April 29, 2008. Lauder also led diplomatic efforts to persuade European businesses to withdraw from Iran. In January 2010, he warmly welcomed the announcement by [[Siemens]] CEO [[Peter Löscher]] that his company would not seek new business in Iran.[http://www.boston.com/business/articles/2010/01/27/siemens_to_stop_doing_business_in_iran/ "Siemens to stop doing business in Iran"]. [[Associated Press]]. January 27, 2010. In February 2018, the [[Poland|Polish]] Prime Minister [[Mateusz Morawiecki]] stated that "there were Jewish perpetrators" of the [[Holocaust]], "not only German perpetrators.""[https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/benjamin-netanyahu-mateusz-morawiecki-jews-perpetrators-holocaust-munich-security-conference-a8216421.html Benjamin Netanyahu attacks Polish PM for saying Jews were among perpetrators of the Holocaust]". ''The Independent.'' 18 February 2018. Lauder condemned Morawiecki's comment as anti-Semitic, saying: "The Polish prime minister [Morawiecki] has displayed appalling ignorance with his unconscionable claim that so-called 'Jewish perpetrators' were partly responsible for the Nazi German attempt to wipe out European Jewry...this government is going to extreme and unfathomable lengths to exonerate some of their countrymen's own complicity in the murders of their neighbors. This is nothing short of an attempt to falsify history, that is one of the very worst forms of anti-Semitism and Holocaust obfuscation. We demand an immediate retraction and apology from the Polish government of these absurd and offensive remarks.".{{cite news |title=Polish PM pays respects to Nazi collaborators underground group |url=https://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-5119435,00.html |work=[[Ynetnews]] |date=18 February 2018}} On 19 April 2018, Ronald Lauder together with international guests took part in official 75th anniversary of the outbreak of the [[Warsaw Ghetto Uprising]] in Poland. Lauder made a long speech near the front of the [[Monument to the Ghetto Heroes]] in Warsaw and said:
We are standing here in a modern day [[Masada]]. Here in this former Warsaw Ghetto area the current ground is about 120 cm above prewar ground, above the rubble, bones and bodies of the heroes. This is holy ground. Every one here today should use these brave young Warsaw Ghetto fighters as an inspiration we will face all challenges ahead. We should learn strength and courage. I know I do. We also know that the death camps were designed, maintained and staffed by German SS troops. Jews, Christians and others were murdered there. Throughout Europe and in Poland there were also brave non-Jews [[[Righteous Among the Nations]]] who risked their lives and saved Jewish lives and were also people who betrayed Jews and sold their property. There was another chapter of great heroism written in Warsaw, here that we must also remember. Just one year after the small band of Polish Jews rose up against the Germans [[[Warsaw Ghetto Uprising]] in 1943], the entire Polish underground fought the German Nazis in one of the most brutal battle of the world [Non-Jewish but Polish [[Warsaw Uprising]] in 1944] and we must honor these great fighters as well in 1944. May God bless the memory of the valiant Polish Jews who fought and died here in the Warsaw Ghetto. May God bless the memory of the valiant Polish Catholics who fought and died here. May God bless all the Jewish people worldwide and all the Polish people. We will fight together against any oppressor who want to destroy our world. God bless Poland![https://www.tvn24.pl/raporty/75-rocznica-powstania-w-getcie-warszawskim,1274 Video available on www.tvn24.pl]
===Support for Conservative Foreign Policy=== In 2018, [[OpenSecrets]] reported that Lauder had donated $1.1 Million to [[Secure America Now]]. The organization committed to educating the American public on the dangers posed to America by the development of nuclear weapons by Iran and radical Islam{{Cite web|url=https://sanfound.org/|title=Secure America Now|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}. ==Israel activism== Lauder has repeatedly come to the defense of Israel in public and is seen as an ally of Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]. In May 2012, he reacted "with dismay" at a suggestion by Ireland's Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister [[Eamon Gilmore]] to impose a European Union-wide import ban on products made in Israeli settlements in the West Bank, which Gilmore said were "illegal" and made peace between Israel and the Palestinians "impossible". Lauder said: "Such boycott calls are cynical and hypocritical. Minister Gilmore is taking aim at the only liberal democracy in the Middle East while keeping quiet about those who really wreak havoc in the region: the Assads, Ahmadinejads and their allies Hezbollah and Hamas." He added that "the West Bank territories are legally disputed and not illegally occupied."[http://www.worldjewishcongress.org/en/news/11814/world_jewish_congress_dismayed_at_irish_call_for_eu_ban_on_israeli_goods_from_west_bank "World Jewish Congress dismayed at Irish call for EU ban on Israeli goods from West Bank"]. Worldjewishcongress.org. (May 23, 2012). In remarks to the [[International Council of Jewish Parliamentarians]] made on June 28, 2011, Lauder reportedly scolded Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for a number of missteps, including lacking a diplomatic plan heading into the September UN vote on Palestinian statehood and setting preconditions for negotiations as part of the Israeli–Palestinian peace process, according to ''[[Haaretz]]''.{{cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/top-jewish-leader-and-close-netanyahu-ally-blasts-pm-for-lack-of-diplomatic-plan-1.370134 |title=Top Jewish leader and close Netanyahu ally blasts PM for lack of diplomatic plan |date=June 29, 2011 |work=Haaretz}} However, in June 2012, on the third anniversary of Israeli Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu#Second Premiership: 2009–2013|Benjamin Netanyahu's speech at Bar-Ilan University]], Lauder published a full-page advertisement in ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' and other newspapers in which he called on Palestinian President [[Mahmoud Abbas]] to return to the negotiating table. "Accept the offer to talk, President Abbas. It takes two sides to make peace," Lauder wrote.[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4242587,00.html "World Jewish Congress urges Abbas to resume talks"]. ''YNet News''. June 17, 2012. ==Channel 10== Lauder has participated in a number of large media deals in Israel, among which was his purchase of part of commercial television [[Channel 10 (Israel)|Channel 10]]. In September 2011, Israeli media published accounts that Lauder had put heavy pressure on the executives of the channel to broadcast a personal apology to the businessman [[Sheldon Adelson]] with regards to a profile that the channel had broadcast in January 2011. The apology read, "After the broadcast of the piece, we checked the accusations. Our checks revealed that the accusations were – and are – completely false... We are very regretful that we did not check these accusations before broadcasting them." Lauder's forcing of the form of the apology led to the resignation of the channel's news chief Reudor Benziman, its news editor Ruti Yuval, and its presenter Guy Zohar (who continues in another post in Channel 10), who criticized Lauder for the pressure he exerted.Averbach, Lior; Barak, Roi (September 9, 2008). [http://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1000680845 "Benziman's Resignation: What really happened behind the scenes at Channel 10 News?"] (in Hebrew). ''[[Globes]]''. Retrieved June 23, 2016.Pritzker, Shelly (September 9, 2008). [http://www.calcalist.co.il/marketing/articles/0,7340,L-3530853,00.html "The Shocks Continue at Channel 10: Ruti Yuval, editor of the Friday edition 'The Week', has resigned"] (in Hebrew). ''[[Calcalist]]''. Retrieved June 23, 2016. Because of the attacks, detailed above, on Lauder (who had been until then the last major funder of the channel), he decided to reconsider his financial support. If the channel lost his funding, it would have difficulty continuing to operate to its current standard past October 2011.Yitzhak, Yoav (September 17, 2011). [http://www.news1.co.il/Archive/001-D-277694-00.html "Channel 10 has no funds for October"] (in Hebrew). [[News First Class]]. Retrieved June 23, 2016. On November 3, 2011, [[The Second Authority for Television and Radio]] reached a decision on the issue in which it decided that the apology to Adelson broadcast by the channel was appropriate and that "no evidence has been presented that there was any intervention by the shareholders of Channel 10 on new content, or even on the text of the apology, which was agreed between the news company and the person injured by the broadcast".''[[Israel Hayom]]'' (''Israel Today''). November 4, 2011. ==Accusations by Austrian Jewish community leader== The [[Israelitische Kultusgemeinde Wien]] (Vienna Israelite Community) banned Lauder for allegedly interfering in its board elections.Staff (December 7, 2012). [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4316799,00.html "Austrian Jewish group bans Ron Lauder"]. [[Reuters]] (via [[Ynetnews]]). Retrieved June 23, 2016. IKG President Oskar Deutsch alleged that Lauder had offered incentives to members of the IKG to support another candidate. A Lauder spokesman denied the allegations.Liphshiz, Cnaan (December 4, 2012). [http://www.jta.org/2012/12/04/news-opinion/world/lauder-accused-of-trying-to-buy-jewish-election-in-vienna "Lauder accused of trying to buy Jewish election in Vienna"]. [[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]. Retrieved June 23, 2016. In January 2013, it was reported that Deutsch and Lauder had resolved their dispute.Liphshiz, Cnaan (January 25, 2013). [http://www.jta.org/2013/01/25/news-opinion/world/ron-lauder-austrian-jewish-community-bury-hatchet "Ron Lauder, Austrian Jewish community bury hatchet"]. [[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]. Retrieved June 23, 2016. ==Residences== A 2007 profile of Lauder in ''[[The New Yorker]]'' magazine detailed his residences, including three properties in Manhattan – a townhouse on East [[70th Street (Manhattan)|70th Street]], a townhouse ([[List of works by Philip Johnson|designed by Philip Johnson]]) on East [[52nd Street (Manhattan)|52nd Street]], as well as an apartment at [[740 Park Avenue]]. The profile additionally listed homes in Florida, London, Paris, and [[Wainscott, New York|Wainscott]], [[Long Island]].Mead, Rebecca (January 15, 2007). [http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2007/01/15/an-acquiring-eye "An Acquiring Eye – Ronald Lauder's Career in Collecting Art"]. ''[[The New Yorker]]''. Retrieved June 23, 2016. "One afternoon, Lauder took me to a town house, on Seventieth Street between Park and Madison Avenues, that his mother bought in the sixties, and in which she lived until her death, in 2004, at ninety-seven. Estée Lauder left an empire worth ten billion dollars, and part of Ronald's inheritance was this house, which he has added to a collection that includes residences in Florida, Paris, and London; an apartment at 740 Park Avenue; and a town house on East Fifty-second Street that was designed by Philip Johnson in 1950 as a guesthouse for Blanchette Rockefeller, who was later the president of MOMA, and which Lauder bought at auction in 2000 for eleven million dollars. There is also a country house in Wainscott, Long Island, on the grounds of which sits an eighteenth-century church that Lauder bought in Massachusetts and had moved to a more convenient spot." ==Personal life== He is married to Jo Carole (Knopf) Lauder.{{cite book|author= [[Lee Israel|Israel, Lee]] |title=Estée Lauder – Beyond the Magic – An Unauthorized Biography |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bZ8QAQAAMAAJ |year =1985 |publisher= [[Macmillan Publishers]] | isbn = 978-0025221000}}{{cite web|last=Mead|first= Rebecca |date=January 15, 2007|url=http://www.bslaw.net/news/newyorker.pdf |format= [[PDF]] |title= An Acquiring Eye |publisher=bslaw.net}}{{cite web| author = Mead, Rebecca | url=http://www.newyorker.com/reporting/2007/01/15/070115fa_fact_mead|title= An Acquiring Eye |date=January 15, 2007|work= [[The New Yorker]] | access-date = June 23, 2016}} They have two children, [[Aerin Lauder Zinterhofer|Aerin]] and [[Jane Lauder|Jane]]. His daughter Jane is married to [[Kevin Warsh]], a former member of the [[Federal Reserve Board of Governors]].[http://www.stanfordalumni.org/news/magazine/2007/novdec/classnotes/warsh.html "Kevin M. Warsh, '92 – The Governor Is In"]. ''Stanford Alumni News''. == Honors == * 2011: [[Andrew Carnegie Medal of Philanthropy]]{{cite web|title=Jo Carole & Ronald Lauder: 2011 Medal Recipients|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dfV9cZepsc4|website=[[Andrew Carnegie Medal of Philanthropy]]|accessdate= January 3, 2016|date= February 29, 2012}} *2018: Andrey Sheptytsky Medal{{Cite web|url=https://www.tabletmag.com/scroll/271797/ronald-lauder-awarded-andrey-sheptytsky-medal-by-ukrainian-jewish-organizations|title=Ronald Lauder Awarded Andrey Sheptytsky Medal by Ukrainian-Jewish Organizations|last=Davidzon|first=Vladislav|date=September 28, 2018|website=Tabletmag.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} ==See also== * [[CME/Lauder v. revision.text:
'''Samuel David Leidesdorf''', (1881-1968) internationally known [[accountant]], recently inducted into the [[CPA Hall of Fame]].
Leidesdorf, was born on September 25, 1881 in [[New York City]]. He attended the [[New York School of Accounting]] and [[Pace College]]. In 1905, he began his own accounting firm, [[S.D. Leidesdorf & Co.]], [[certified public accountant]]s, which grew and eventually became one of the largest accounting firms in the nation. The 1915 New York City Directory shows him living at 302 West 79th and with the S.D. Leidesdorf Co office at 417 5th Avenue.<ref>[http://content.ancestry.com/Browse/view.aspx?dbid=8773&path=New+York+City.1915.L.33 1915 New York City Directory], online at www.ancestry.com</ref> His World War I Draft Registration Card shows he had moved to 309 W 86th.<ref>[http://content.ancestry.com/Browse/view.aspx?dbid=6482&path=New+York.Manhattan+City.126.L.94&fn=Samuel%20David&ln=Leidesdorf&st=r&pid=17519580&rc=&zp=100 WW1 Draft Registration Card], online at www.ancestry.com</ref> In 1929, he helped arrange the sale of [[Newark, New Jersey|Newark-based]] [[Bamberger's]] department store, to the [[Macy's|R.H. Macy]] Co.<ref>[http://www.commentarymagazine.com/Summaries/V35I5P41-1.htm ''Commentary'' magazine] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050421162649/http://www.commentarymagazine.com/Summaries/V35I5P41-1.htm |date=2005-04-21 }}</ref> [[Fortune Magazine]] recognized his company as a “Pioneering Firm” in 1932.
In 1931 he was on the executive committee of the [[American Jewish Committee]].<ref>[http://scplweb.santacruzpl.org:2281/hqoweb/library/do/books/results/image?urn=urn:proquest:US;glhbooks;Genealogy-glh47067257;-1;-1;&polarity=&scale=&hitthreadid=347 ''The American Jewish yearbook''], Jewish Publication Society of America, Philadelphia. 1931. 532 pages</ref> He served on the [[State Council of Accountancy]], from 1934 to 1942. When [[Einstein]] arrived in the US, Leidesdorf was his accountant.<ref>[http://www.crossingwallstreet.com/archives/2005/12/albert_einstein.html Crossingwallstreet.com Archives] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060901111123/http://www.crossingwallstreet.com/archives/2005/12/albert_einstein.html |date=2006-09-01 }}</ref> He soon began dedicating himself to what would become a lifetime of philanthropic endeavors for medical and educational institutions, and many other charitable causes, including the [[Red Cross]], the [[United Jewish Communities|United Jewish Appeal]], the [[Young Women's Christian Association]] and the [[United Negro College Fund]]. "In a letter written to Mr. S. D. Leidesdorf of New York, [[John D. Rockefeller, Jr.|Rockefeller]] solicited Leidesdorf to serve as a member of the Foundation Committee of the UNCF, working with W. D. Embree, the Chairman."<ref>[http://scplweb.santacruzpl.org:2299/itx/retrieve.do?subjectParam=Locale%2528en%252C%252C%2529%253AFQE%253D%2528su%252CNone%252C10%2529Leidesdorf%2524&contentSet=IAC-Documents&sort=DateDescend&tabID=T002&sgCurrentPosition=0&subjectAction=DISPLAY_SUBJECTS&prodId=ITOF&searchId=R1&currentPosition=4&userGroupName=scruzpl&resultListType=RESULT_LIST&sgHitCountType=None&qrySerId=Locale%28en%2C%2C%29%3AFQE%3D%28TX%2CNone%2C10%29Leidesdorf%24&inPS=true&searchType=BasicSearchForm&displaySubject=&docId=A98253620&docType=IAC ''The early years of the United Negro College Fund, 1943-1960''. Shuana K. Tucker. The Journal of African American History (Fall 2002): p416(17).]</ref>
Mr. Leidesdorf was active in civic and community service and received numerous honors and awards, including an honorary degree as doctor of humane letters from [[Hebrew Union College]], the Medal of the [[National Fund for Medical Education]], the [[Herbert H. Lehman Human Relations Award]] of the [[American Jewish Committee]] and the [[Medal for Distinguished Service]] from the [[Protestant Council]] of the City of New York. In 1958, Mr. Leidesdorf received [[The Hundred Year Association of New York]]'s Gold Medal Award "in recognition of outstanding contributions to the City of New York." He was a founding Trustee for the [[Institute for Advanced Study]].
In 1948, Mr. Leidesdorf began his tenure on the board of the New York University Medical Center serving as the first Chair of the Building Committee. Later he served as the Chair of the board from 1956 until his death on September 21, 1968.
He was chairman of the board of [[New York University School of Medicine|NYU Medical Center]] from 1956 to 1968. At the time of his death in 1968, the firm he founded was in the top 10 of accounting firms in the United States. The company he started merged to become [[Ernst & Whinney]] in 1979 and [[Ernst and Young]] in 1989.
With his wife Elsa Grunwald, he had two children Helen and Arthur (1918–91). Arthur D. like his father, was a philanthropist. Arthur also married Tova, a prior beauty-contest winner and International Socialite, who continues his philanthropic work. Tova was honored in 2003 as "Woman of the Year" by the [[Shaare Zedek Medical Center]].
==Notes== <references/>
==Resources== *[http://www.nysscpa.org/society/PR/5-18-05releaseb.htm Hall of Fame induction] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060507071704/http://www.transmediagroup.com/newsroom/2003/1118Tova.htm Street named for him] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060907192004/http://www.med.nyu.edu/alumni/clubs/leidesdorf.html Leidesdorf Club] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060901103148/http://www.ias.edu/Newsroom/announcements/Uploads/view.php?cmd=view&id=262 IAS site] *[http://www.familytreeexpert.com/legacy/samuel_david_leidesdorf.htm Picture] *1930 US Federal Census *Social Security Death Index *[http://trees.ancestry.com/owt/person.aspx?pid=174438456 OneWorldTree] *World War I Draft Registration Card, published by ancestry.com
==Further reading== *Biography Index. A cumulative index to biographical material in books and magazines. Volume 4: September, 1955-August, 1958. New York: H.W. Wilson Co., 1960. (BioIn 4) *Biography Index. A cumulative index to biographical material in books and magazines. Volume 8: September, 1967-August, 1970. New York: H.W. Wilson Co., 1971. (BioIn 8) *Who Was Who in America. Volume 5, 1969-1973. Chicago: Marquis Who's Who, 1973. (WhAm 5)
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leidesdorf, Samuel D.}} [[Category:American accountants]] [[Category:1881 births]] [[Category:1968 deaths]] [[Category:Pace University alumni]] [[Category:American Jews]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New York City]]

revision.text:
'''Sergei Vladimirovich Kolesnikov''' ({{lang-ru|Сергей Владимирович Колесников}}; born 1948, Leningrad) is a Russian businessman and former associate of [[Vladimir Putin]] currently believed to be living in exile in [[Tallinn]], [[Estonia]]. He is best known as a whistleblower after his December 2010 letter to [[Dmitry Medvedev]], which exposed the corrupt scheme that included the construction of '[[Putin's Palace]]' and challenged the Russian president to fight corruption.<ref>[http://corruptionfreerussia.com/ Corruption Free Russia<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Articles of his in the Russian press have continued this theme.<ref>http://www.vedomosti.ru/newspaper/article/260677/prizrak_dvorca</ref><ref>http://www.vedomosti.ru/newspaper/article/261532/bolshoj_medicinskij_raspil</ref>
==Career==
Kolesnikov graduated from the Leningrad Polytechnical Institute in 1972, where he studied biophysics. He holds a doctorate from the Sergei Kirov Military Medical Academy, and spent 20 years as a scientist specialising in the applications of biophysics in medicine.<ref name=autogenerated1>[http://www.snob.ru/selected/entry/37367 Сергей Колесников: Почему я рассказал про Дворец Путина. «Мы перешли границу между добром и злом в 2009 году» – Интервью – Тематические материалы – Сноб<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
In 1991 he and scientific colleagues combined with the St Petersburg health authorities to found a state enterprise to manufacture medical equipment which they had been developing. In 1992, when it became legal, they set up a joint stock company called Petromed. Vladmir Putin, then head of the St Petersburg Committee on External Economic Affairs, was one of the founders. Petromed expanded through the 1990s from the manufacture of equipment to procurement, and from procurement to major health infrastructure projects. The election of [[Vladimir Yakovlev]] as Mayor St Petersburg was a setback for Petromed as the company did not enjoy as good relations with him as they had with [[Anatoly Sobchak]]. The publicly owned stake in the company was sold so that Kolesnikov and another of the co-founders, Dmitri Gorelov, each held a 50% stake.<ref name=autogenerated1 />
==Putin's palace==
Kolesnikov's involvement in this is described in his letter to Medvedev and has been covered by the media, notably by [[David Ignatius]] in the Washington Post, who concluded from his investigations that 'Kolesnikov is one of those brave souls a journalist meets occasionally, who decides to expose what he sees as wrongdoing, regardless of the personal risks.' <ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/12/22/AR2010122203770.html David Ignatius - Sergey Kolesnikov's tale of palatial corruption, Russian style<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In 2000 Kolesnikov was approached by Nikolai Shamalov, a contact from Petromed's early days, on behalf of Putin. Putin proposed the following scheme: Petromed would be commissioned to undertake a number of health infrastructure projects, funded by oligarchs, including Roman Abramovich. A proportion of the donations would be siphoned into an offshore investment fund, in which Putin would have by far the largest stake.
This scheme went ahead, as well as 'Project South', aka Putin's Palace, which Shamalov supervised. Kolesnikov claims that he became disillusioned when, in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis, he was instructed that all funds were to be directed to Putin's Palace and investment projects on which people's livelihoods depended were to be shut down. In September 2010 he left Russia having decided to become a whistleblower. After consulting lawyers and meeting with Washington Post columnist David Ignatius he published his letter to Medvedev, which met with official denials. The plausibility of these denials has been undermined by investigations by Novaya Gazeta, which revealed a paper trail going back to the Kremlin.<ref>[http://en.novayagazeta.ru/data/2011/016/00.html Novayagazeta | February 14, 2011 №16 | 740 square metre palace<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110907110633/http://en.novayagazeta.ru/data/2011/016/00.html |date=September 7, 2011 }}</ref>
Asked by [[Masha Gessen]] why he had become a whistleblower he replied, 'On the one hand, it's a complicated question, on the other hand, it's simple. If you are a Russian, if Russia is your homeland, and if you have something you can do for her, then the act is perfectly natural. Sometimes I wondered whether I would be able, for example, to 'go over the top' as my father did. Well, I came to the conclusion that maybe I could.' On Russia today he is pessimistic, 'My analysis led to the conclusion that the country has no real positive development. The country is heading for collapse. Moreover, for a really serious collapse, possibly revolution. And considering that today Russia is a nuclear power, and that revolution in a country where there is a huge number of nuclear weapons is an incredibly dangerous thing for the existence of the whole world, I came to the conclusion that something had to be done. These were the main motives for my decision to write the letter. Well, in the end, let's say, I have lived most of my life, I've got children and grandchildren, and not just me, everyone.' <ref name=autogenerated1 />
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Kolesnikov, Sergei}} [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Russian whistleblowers]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Russian physicists]] [[Category:Russian biologists]] [[Category:Vladimir Putin]] [[Category:People from Saint Petersburg]]
